A giant snake monster that moves through the ground and attacks from the feet up. <lf>A special kind of sand viper that swims in the sand sea while absorbing engrams of lightning that accumulate in the ground. It is said that the appearance of the viper as it launches a powerful attack on its prey from the ground looks like a lightning bolt released from the ground.
The Avaritia lurks in the innermost part of Insect Fortress. <lf>It attacks anyone who enters its interior without regard. It is difficult to even find it because it hides itself underground in the intricate ruins. This is one of the main reasons why the investigation of "Insect Fortress of Dawn" has been so difficult.
He is also treated as an important warning target by the Pioneer Bureau. His cunning nature and deadly poison have caused many adventurers to fall in the middle of their ambitions. The key to victory is to be ready to catch him when he peeks out from under the ground.
A giant snake monster that moves through the ground and attacks from underfoot. <lf>It is a variant of the sand viper, which possesses a fire engram. Its bodily fluids contain a paralyzing poison that causes a burning heat and Paralysis when touched. Adventurers who have been Accepted and dried in the sun are sometimes found in their path.
A type of "flux" that has become ferocious accepting the distortion of avaritia. <lf>It attacks its prey from underground, swallows it whole, and disappears back into the earth. Since it leaves no trace, its victims were thought to have disappeared in an unexplained accident until its true identity was discovered by the Pioneer Bureau.
A flightless bird monster that walks on the ground. <lf>Its legs are short and it walks slowly, so when it is in a hurry, it glides on the ground on its abdomen. ATK is not aggressive and can be approached if one gets used to it, but it is surprisingly strong. Even adults fall on their butts when struck by its wings.
A flightless bird monster that walks on the ground. <lf>They are deeply committed to their mission of protecting their flock mates, and lead the pack toward foreign enemies. They are quite powerful, and can deliver blows that can break bones even when wearing armor. If we do not show hostility, they will do nothing.
A flightless bird monster that walks on the ground. <lf>Its entire body glows, giving it a striking presence. It skillfully manipulates its engrams to change its light to threaten, court, direct the flock, and so on. It seems to be popular among mind-peckers.
A flightless bird monster that walks on the ground. <lf>They are cheerful and dance together when the weather is nice. It is said that seeing them makes them happy, but they run away when they notice people, so they must be watched quietly from afar.
A flightless bird monster that walks on the ground. <lf>They can store engrams in their thorax and radiate them as electric blasts. They seem to be showing friendship to the birds, and they often offend non-hostile birds by delivering electric blasts to them.
A type of "flux" that has become ferocious, accepting the distortions of avaritia. <lf>Their original charm and friendliness have vanished, and they are hostile toward any and all opponents. Unable to stop even if they themselves are injured, they will just keep on hitting each other, and in many cases, they will just die out.
Mysterious creatures that came from somewhere. <lf>The green ones are harmless and are accepted by the people as neighbors of the mischief makers. The purple ones are aggressive, and beyond the scope of mischief, they have become monsters to be defeated.
A brightly colored variant of the nappo. It is small and quick, and its attacks are hard to hit. It seems to enjoy chasing after adventurers, and even in the midst of a fight, it chirps in a good mood. If you approach him in the same nappo form, he might just appear in a flash.
A mysterious creature that came from somewhere. <lf>They love the sunlight and move around actively during the day. When the sun goes down, he becomes less excited and hides himself away. It is said that it will tell you its favorite sunbathing spot if you like it.
A mysterious creature from somewhere. <lf>The nappo is as silvery white and glistening as the moon. They are rarely encountered, and their ecology, including why they look like this, is shrouded in mystery. Adventurers who succeed in defeating them are held in high esteem.
A mysterious creature from somewhere. <lf>The nappo shines as golden as the sun. It is so rare that it is said to be encountered only once in a lifetime, and has become something of a legend. Only a handful of adventurers are lucky enough to see one, and only a handful of adventurers are successful in defeating it.
A mysterious creature that came from somewhere. <lf>This special nappa has a unique pattern reminiscent of a flower. Many travelers are intrigued by its aromatic scent. They roam only during the daytime, and there are anecdotes in many places where they have been mistaken for flower gardens.
A mysterious creature that came from somewhere. <lf>Moreover, it wears a diving mask wherever it is found. Usually, it spends its time freely in the water, but sometimes it inadvertently appears on land when it is swept away. No one has ever seen what is under the mask.
A mysterious creature that came from somewhere. <lf>It wears a mysterious mask, but it seems to just like it. It sometimes performs mysterious dances and sings strange songs, but these have no particular meaning. They roam the forest at will, and attack when the mood strikes them.
A mysterious creature that came from somewhere. <lf>He does not seem to know where he wandered into the world from, but he is enjoying his life. He may have a strong heart, or he may not be thinking, but he is doing what he likes at his own pace, even during battle.
A type of "flux" that has become ferocious and violent accepting the distortions of avaritia. <lf>It is a vicious and dangerous monster, and cannot be identified with a purple nappa, let alone a green one. Its intelligence has improved, and it uses cunning tactics to distract adventurers and force other monsters to finish them off.
A ferocious carnivorous monster that attacks even opponents larger than itself. <lf>It shakes its wings and emits vibrations to disturb the consciousness of its prey. Its well-developed jaws can easily devour meat and even chew through bones. It is more dangerous than a simple beast, and people are urged to flee immediately upon encountering it.
A ferocious carnivorous monster that attacks even opponents larger than itself. <lf>It moves between two territories, one by day and the other by night. By day, they are active in the lowlands and can be seen in human living areas. At night, they move to higher elevations or deeper into the countryside and disappear. Even if you drive them away, they are likely to return the next day.
A ferocious carnivorous monster that attacks even opponents larger than itself. <lf>They are larger than normal kagachi yanmas, and their ferocity and appetite have increased. It is said that in the past, villages that were attacked by a swarm of these monsters destroyed houses without regard, and were reduced to ruins in a single night.
A ferocious carnivorous monster that attacks even opponents larger than itself. <lf>An extremely ferocious and dangerous variant of the giant goliath. Its wings and joints emit strange and grating sounds. Some people have suffered from mental disorders as a result of these sounds, as well as fear and auditory hallucinations.
A ferocious carnivorous monster that attacks even opponents larger than itself. <lf>A variant of the kagachi yamma, which is known for its cunning. It preferentially targets weak opponents such as children and small animals. They regularly move the location of their nests to avoid being chased, showing their high level of intelligence.
A ferocious carnivorous monster that attacks even opponents larger than itself. <lf>A special kind of kagachi yanma hunts during the night when its prey is sleeping. If you hear the sound of its wings on the road at night, be on the alert. If you hear the sound of their wings, be on the alert, for they could disappear without a trace in the morning, leaving only their cargo behind.
A ferocious carnivorous monster that attacks even opponents larger than itself. <lf>A special type of kagachiyanma that appears only at night. It is a vicious monster that lurks in the darkness and takes the lives of many travelers. It is always extremely difficult to defeat it, not only by surprise, but also because it is quite formidable even when fought head-on.
A type of Bapharia heritage that is still in operation today. <lf>It converges engrams of ice and fires light bullets tinged with cold air. Although the performance of each individual is not that high, a large number of them encircle the area, eliminating escape routes and suppressing intruders.
A mutated being in which various thoughts have failed to become an Imagine. <lf>Weapons left behind in ruins and battlefields are transformed into this form, and they continue to move on their own to fulfill their mission of "battle. It has no clear intention, but only attacks those who approach it according to its ingrained thoughts.
A being mutated by various thoughts that failed to become an Imagine. <lf>The persistence of trying to protect oneself or survive during the dispersal has stuck. With a strong defensive instinct, they try to keep their enemies away by scattering stones and gravel fragments by means of earth engrams.
A mutated being in which various thoughts have failed to become an Imagine. <lf>It is said to be inhabited by thoughts that have lost their way and wandered off. The blasts of electricity that it carries around it travel through the sky, but they never end up anywhere, and disappear into the void after striking down the enemy in front of it.
A mutated being in which various thoughts fail to become an Imagine. <lf>It is a being that has been mutated by the failure of various thoughts to become Imagine, and it rages with a mixture of strong anger and hostility, spewing flames. It has a strong aggressive impulse, and will not stop moving until the blade is shattered, and will continue to fight.
A mutated entity that has failed to become an Imagine of various thoughts. <lf>A deep lamentation of fear and despair freezes the blade of the sword. The sound of the wind cutting through the air sounds like a scream, and there are endless stories of people seeing visions of someone beyond the cold air.
A being mutated by various thoughts that failed to become an Imagine. <lf>They are possessed by feelings of remorse and repentance and run amok. It is believed that the engrams of light it emits are a sign of its suffering, and that destroying it is the least it can do as a sign of mercy.
A mutated being in which various thoughts fail to become an Imagine. <lf>The darkness of hatred, malice, and resentment clings to them. It does not react well to other monsters, but when it finds a human, it attacks violently, even slashing at corpses.
A mutated entity that has failed to become an Imagine of various thoughts. <lf>A variant of the Draug Edge with a large swing and immense ATK. It is speculated that this is the sword used by Oberdraug Alma, and caution is taken to prevent the two from being combined.
A type of Bapharia heritage that is still in operation today. <lf>It is not a levitating vehicle, but a walking structure with multiple legs. It is highly mobile and surprisingly fast on its feet. It can be applied in various situations, such as sticking to walls and ceilings and moving debris out of the way.
A type of Bapharia heritage still in operation today. <lf>A type modified from the Pale Pod and specialized for defense. It has a robust body and a barrier made of engrams to protect its colleagues. Since its functions are concentrated on defense, it has few means of attack.
A type of Bapharia heritage that is still in operation today. <lf>Pale pods modified to be able to perform emergency repairs. It assists other Bapharia heritage to support the front lines. Analysis of this behavior has led to the current restoration techniques of the heritage.
A type of Bapharia heritage that is still in operation today. <lf>Pale pods with a large amount of engrams built in and a self-destruct function. According to one theory, it was used for mining development as a self-propelled blasting device. The scale of the explosion is large and dangerous unless movement is restricted.
An amorphous life form created by the transformation of engrams. <lf>It is a mass of fire engrams and appears to be a flame moving around as it is. It is a target for defeat because it can cause wildfires and suspicious fires. It has no will, but reacts and becomes hostile when attacked.
An amorphous life form created by the transformation of engrams. <lf>It floats while emitting cold air from ice engrams. It was tested to see if it could be kept in one place and used for cooling, but was abandoned because it would disappear when the engrams ran out.
An amorphous life form created by the transformation of engrams. <lf>It is easy to spot even at night, as it continuously discharges engrams of lightning. On rare occasions, it releases all engrams at once, causing a large explosion that blows up the entire surrounding area.
An irregularly shaped life form created by the alteration of engrams. <lf>It attracts stones and rocks due to the action of highly concentrated soil engrams. There is a record that when a large outbreak occurred in the past, the surrounding terrain changed and the town was swallowed by a crack in the ground, and the Pioneer Bureau has listed the area as a warning target.
An irregularly shaped life form created by the transformation of engrams. <lf>It emits a dazzling radiance caused by an engram of light. Because of its outward appearance, it is said to be divine and mysterious, and some traditions in which it appears as a divine messenger or miracle in Bapharia are said to be the result of mistaking it for such a being.
An amorphous life form created by the transformation of engrams. <lf>It is said to be a symbol of bad luck that anyone who sees it will suffer misfortune. It is said to be a symbol of bad luck that brings misfortune to those who see it, which is why many witnesses request adventurers to take it down.
A rogue who builds castles outside of towns and deep in the mountains. <lf>He makes his living by robbing novice adventurers and ordinary people of their money and goods. He is a low-ranking member of the group, and is thrown into the front lines to face the enemy head-on. He has a lot of bravado, but his weaponry is poor, and he has many gaps.
They are ruffians who build castles outside of towns and deep in the mountains. <lf>Because of their night vision, they are good at nighttime activities and fighting in dark places such as caves. They often watch from the shadows. They are not good at hiding, so if you are careful, you can easily spot them approaching.
Rugged bandits who build their strongholds outside the city or deep in the mountains. <lf>They are skilled bandits unmatched by others. Because of their unique use of swords, they are thought to have drifted from distant regions. It is not known why he became a bandit.

They can be easily neutralized once they get close, but they are difficult to fight because they use their friends as shields.

They are good at hiding, but once they find a place, they don't move, so once they find it, they can be dealt with.
A rogue who builds castles outside the city and deep in the mountains. <lf>A skilled bandit archer who excels at precision shooting. He is so good at shooting down flying birds that he could have become an excellent hunter, but now he is only called by the arranged derogatory name.
A rogue who builds castles outside the city and deep in the mountains. <lf>He serves as a watchman. He has weapons, but they are not very powerful. He casually uses his friends as shields to keep himself out of the line of fire.

A rogue who builds a stronghold outside the city or deep in the mountains. <lf>He is a scout for a skilled bandit whose true identity is unknown. With his keen senses and quick wits, he has managed to fend off all attempts by the Pioneer Bureau to track him down. No one has ever seen his true face.
A rogue who builds his roots outside the city and deep in the mountains. <lf>He has learned to manipulate engrams like a Spell Caster. Although it is a nasty ability, it is not so much of a threat compared to the Spell Caster's main job, as it is a single-minded attacker with monotonous movements.

Database Ownership <lf> # <lf> # The TZ database itself is not an IETF Contribution or an IETF <lf> # document. Tips
How to end the game
Open the command menu <lf>and select [Exit Game] in the lower right corner. <lf><lf>The next time you log in, you will start from the nearby revival point.
<span color="Action">Auto run (automatic movement) can be performed with [&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="AutoRun"/><span color="Action">] &lt;/&gt;. <lf>The direction of movement can be adjusted by operating the camera. <lf>You can interrupt <lf>autorun by pressing <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="AutoRun"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; or the move key again.
Spatial Transfer Portal
If your destination is far away, use a spatial transfer portal. <lf><lf>Open the map in the command menu at <lf>to see and use the registered spatial transfer portals.
class change
When changing classes, you must have a <lf>class-specific weapon. <lf><lf>You can change classes in the field or on the free exploration map by changing <lf>weapons.
Weapon Crafting
You can craft weapons at the rolling ball training ceremony in town. <lf>The materials needed for crafting can be used from the <lf>warehouse, so there is no need to retrieve them from the <lf>warehouse.
You can make your weapon stronger by asking a weapon modifier. <lf>Visit him when you have the "Ability Plug". <lf>By attaching the plug to an empty socket on your weapon, you can increase the <lf>abilities of your weapon.
Weapon modifier: plug mounted
Once you have an "Ability Plug", it's time for a weapon modifier. <lf>You can attach the plug to your weapon and add abilities to it. <lf>Each ability plug has different abilities, so you can customize your weapon by attaching the plug of your choice. <lf>
Weapon Modifiers: Plug Tuning
Weapon Remodeler: Weapon Tuning
Plug tuning changes the accuracy of <lf>the abilities you have given your weapon. <lf>Once you have a good ability plug installed, try <lf>plug tuning to increase the accuracy.
Tuning changes the accuracy of <lf>the abilities you have given your weapon. <lf>Once you have fitted a good ability plug, try <lf>tuning to increase its accuracy.
Weapons Remodeler: Plug Removal
Removes ability plugs attached to weapons. <lf>Use <lf>when you want to try out new ability combinations.
Weapon modifier: Socket expansion
Increase the number of sockets on your weapons up to four. <lf>Attach ability plugs to the increased sockets and <lf>make your favorite weapons stronger and stronger.
Adventures can be dangerous. <lf>If you don't have a lot of recovery medicine on hand, you can purchase some at <lf>the tool store. <lf>Don't forget to carry them in your bag!
You can purchase weapons for each class. <lf><lf>It is useful to purchase these weapons in advance, as you will need to have a weapon of that class when you change classes <lf>.
The Coloring Shop allows you to change the color of your outfit. <lf><lf>When you apply the changed color to your equipment, <lf>a special dye will be consumed. <lf>The trial is free, so feel free to try it out.
You can change and save your appearance at any time. <lf><lf>A special <lf>ticket is consumed to reflect the changed appearance on the player character. <lf>Some hairstyles and makeup are only available at the esthetic salon.
You can check, sell, and retrieve items that have been deposited. <lf>You can also retrieve equipment used in "Battle Build" <lf>in bulk, so you can use this function when you want to make major changes to your equipment, such as when changing classes <lf>.
You can exchange GC (Glory Coin) and other currencies for <lf>costumes and event items. <lf><lf>You can also find limited time commemorative items at <lf>, so it's a good idea to check back often.
development bureau
You can receive and report quests from the receptionist at the Pioneer Station. <lf><lf>The number of quests will increase as you progress in the main quests, etc. <lf>so be sure to check often.
Supplied items are automatically registered in the item palette. <lf><lf>The key to use an item can be changed in the <lf>optional operation settings.
Talk mode can be started from <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="ChatMode"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt;. <lf><lf>You can chat and stamp <lf>gestures with other characters.
You can do a character search at <lf>from the "Communicate" menu in the command menu. <lf><lf>Search for other characters using various criteria. <lf>You may have unexpected encounters.
Auto Message Settings
You can set it up from Communicate's Talk Management. <lf><lf>You can also have it automatically dispatched during the battle. <lf>Set the conditions and the content of the dispatch in advance.
Edit Shortcut Rings
<span color="Action">You can display the shortcut ring with [&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="ShortcutRing"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; and then edit the shortcut ring with <lf><span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="EditShortcutRing"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt;. <lf>Consumable items, gestures, stamps, and canned text can be registered. <lf>There are multiple rings, so you can use different rings for different purposes <lf>such as for battles, communication, etc.
You can check your character's information and edit comments at <lf>from "Communicate" &gt; "Adventurer Card" in the command menu. <lf><lf>You can also use the mood icon to easily communicate your situation to surrounding players at <lf>.
How to form a party
By pressing <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Interaction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; against another player, you can view <lf>player information and invite them to a party. <lf><lf>You can also recruit and search for parties from the command menu.
Leaving and Dissolving a Party
You can leave a party from "Party" in the command menu at <lf>. <lf>If you are the party leader, you can also disband.
Party Wanted Listing
From the "Party" menu of the command menu, <lf>you can check the list of party members wanted and join the party. <lf><lf>You can also recruit your own party members.
What is a team?
Members can talk to each other, view team activities and <lf>increase their team rank. <lf><lf>Form a team with like-minded people and enjoy <lf>a fun adventurer's life.
Check out our Travel Guide!
If you need help or are stuck on an adventure, go to the Adventure Handbook in the <lf>command menu and look at the Travel Guide. <lf><lf>The Traveler's Guide has help categorized by category and is <lf>searchable, so you can search for anything you are interested in.
How to raise your Adventurer Rank
Myulie at the Pioneer Station will increase your adventurer rank. <lf>When your rank is raised, you will be able to enjoy further adventures, such as additional quests and missions that you can Accept <lf>. <lf>You can check the conditions for rank advancement at any time from "Character" <lf>"Adventurer Rank" in the command menu.
Imagine's Craft
You can craft <lf>Battle Imagine and Enhance Imagine at the Imagine Lab. <lf><lf>Don't forget to equip your crafted Imagine from the command menu <lf>!
You can start a completed mission at any time from the <lf>mission in the command menu. <lf>If you choose "Matching Application" at this time, <lf>will start the mission with a simple party for that mission only. <lf>Feel free to challenge the mission.
In Time Attack, you will receive <lf>titles and other rewards for every specific time you beat. <lf><lf>You can also get even more special rewards if you get into the rankings. <lf>Let's try again and again.
Arena, Rush Battle
Enemies that battle in groups in rush battles <lf>will attack you one after another. <lf><lf>It is difficult to break through solo, so try <lf>to challenge them with a party.
At the start of the season, you will receive a free Basic Pass. <lf>As you accumulate season points ( <lf>) from completing daily quests and other activities, your season rank will increase and you will receive rewards. <lf>The Basic Pass can also be upgraded to a paid pass with purchase benefits at <lf>.
Costumes include "upper wear," "arm wear," and other costume parts, which can be worn in any combination <lf>. <lf>The parameters do not change depending on the costume. <lf>Please enjoy coordinating various costumes and accessories.
At the Regnus Store, you can exchange Rose Orbs and BP points for <lf>costumes, season passes, consumable items, and more. <lf><lf>The store offers a variety of items that will make your adventures fun and convenient. <lf>The items change regularly, so be sure to check back often.
Skyquake Fields
It is a meadow that gently welcomes adventurers who have just left Asterleeds. <lf>It is a great place for new adventurers to test their skills, and <lf>many adventurers come and go today.
Minster Hills
A pleasant breeze blows through the hills. <lf>The windmill in Minsterhorn, which takes advantage of the constantly blowing wind, is <lf>also a famous landmark of the village.
Andra Basin
The basin is surrounded by cliffs and mountains with bare rock surfaces due to the subsidence of part of the terrain. <lf>The ruins of the ancient city of Andra, located at the northern end of the basin, are now uninhabited and in ruins. <lf>It is called the Soundless City. <lf>The ruins are garrisoned by the Order of Bapharia, which <lf>guards the ruins to prevent vicious monsters from rampaging outside the ruins.
Calm Eve Terraces
The area is divided into two areas due to the uplift of the earth. <lf>Many adventurers go to explore the ruins of the "Ancient City of Ville," but <lf>the enemy is also strong, so when the time comes, it is best to take a <lf>rest in the "Shade of the Straggler's Rock.
Soundless Foothills
<lf>The zone has been known as a trade route to Litze since ancient times, but recently it has become a dangerous trade route <lf>as the village of Bergmar was recently attacked by the Enemy. <lf>There are also goblin settlements, and the pilgrimages of oracle priestesses are now accompanied by skilled guards <lf>.
Fiel Pond
It is a zone where water flows everywhere, including around the "Augurus Ruins," which are now submerged in a cascading waterfall <lf>. <lf>It is also known as a training ground for skilled adventurers <lf>as there are camps of goblins and the enemies are quite strong.
Divine Haven Hill
This is a zone with a cool climate, watched over by the "Pillar of Divinity," the sacred site of the Bapharia cult, which rises high <lf>. <lf>Many of the rocks surrounding the Pillar hang down their heads facing the Pillar <lf>and are mentioned in Bapharia's scriptures <lf>as miracles of Bapharia's divine power. <lf>
Ritze Tradeway
This zone is centered around "Litze," a much-loved resting place <lf>for traders heading for the faraway desert city of Salamzart. <lf>Tower Rock" in the vicinity of Litze was once known as a mine that produced high quality ore <lf>.
Melisos River Basin
It is famous for "Litse Great Cave," which stretches along the Melissos River. <lf>It is also known as a scenic zone, including "Falling Dragon Falls," which is so steep that even dragon tribes are said to fall from it. <lf> <lf>At the eastern end is the Arid Valley Pass, which leads to the desert, where <lf>gatekeepers stand guard to keep people safe.
Abandoned Galley Ridge Road
This zone in Montegnor Valley has many steep cliff paths. <lf>There is a beautiful body of water called "The Watering Place of the Sublunar Dragon," but only a handful of adventurers can make it to <lf>. <lf>Adventurers who are skilled enough may try <lf>"Galey Ridge Village Ruins," which is now a bandit hideout.
Old Rainfall Road
This is one of the most varied zones in the Evergreen Desert, including "Insect Fortress of Dawn," a huge mound that has been painstakingly built up by insects over the years, <lf>and "Khartoum Ruins," reputed to offer a spectacular view of the desert from the top. <lf> <lf>Since it is a long way from Salamzart, <lf>make sure you have a well-developed mount before heading there.
Shimmering Valley
The "Shimmering Valley," which greets travelers from Montegnor Valley with a dry wind, is a relatively stable climate zone in the <lf>Evergreen Desert. <lf>Many travelers first acclimate themselves to the desert climate at the "Hunter's Encampment" here before heading to <lf>Salamzart.
Olvid Plains
This zone hosts the desert city of Salamzart. <lf>The balloons placed here and there are signposts by Salamzart merchants who want to welcome their guests <lf>on their long journey as soon as possible. <lf>When heading for Salamzart, <lf>look up in the sky and follow the balloons.
Breathless Wasteland
It is here, in the "Breathless Wasteland," that the winds that blow across the desert somehow weaken. <lf>The huge "Rock Tower of the Sacred Ritual" that rises in this zone is <lf>a tomb dedicated to the ancestral spirits of the people of this region. <lf>The people of Salamzart, who cherish their ancestors, <lf>still remember to pray to the "Rock Tower of the Sacred Ritual".
Hollowed Tempest
Hollowed Tempest is almost never set foot in, but there is a camp called <lf>"The Signpost of the Caravan". <lf>If you happen to set foot in the Hollowed Tempest, <lf>is the first place you should look. <lf>If you are lucky, you may be rescued by a skilled adventurer.
Rauleben Battlefield
This is an old battlefield where the proud knights of the Duchy of Bernhardt engaged in numerous <lf>battles with the dragon tribe. <lf>The ruins of collapsed fortifications, facilities, and destroyed turrets still remain, <lf>conveying the traces of the fierce battles that took place in the past.
Castle Shadows
The square in front of the back gate of Bernhardt Castle and the surrounding area. <lf>It is said that during the war against the dragon tribe, knights and soldiers gathered here <lf>and raised their spirits to defend their homeland and people.
Stahl Coast
It is the westernmost part of the Duchy of Bernhardt. <lf><lf>Across the sea is the stronghold of the dragon tribes, which has been the front line in many wars. <lf>There are still many traces of those days.
waiting for the rising tide or a good opportunity
Centered on the pioneer town of Jubilia, this is the most <lf>developed area in "Cape Rauwehara". <lf>Although still in its infancy, the open land is being planted with crops and <lf>is being prepared as a base for buildings.
canyon hidden under the moon
It is the most remote area of Cape Rauwehara. <lf><lf>It is a place of unspoiled nature and has been the object of people's worship since ancient times. <lf>The area continues into the interior of the outer continent and is covered with deep forests.
Ia Mole Reef
It is a beautiful Coast region where the sun shines and the sound of the waves never ceases. <lf>The beach, which symbolizes "Cape Rauwehara," is lined with countless <lf>rocks that have been deposited by corals, creating a unique landscape. <lf>Many caves are found in the shadows of the rocks.
Silent Forest
It is a forest area in the southern part of "Koaniani Forest. <lf>Centered on "Ulrau Village," where the forest people live, the vast, lush forest stretches <lf>endlessly. <lf>It is a precious place where you can have contact with the forest people.
Zero Area of Life Tree
It is a precious virgin forest in the northern part of the "Koaniani Forest" <lf>that has remained untouched for thousands of years. <lf>It is sacred land for the forest people, and anyone who destroys it is <lf>recognized as a clear enemy and eliminated.
breaking through or surpassing one's limit
By using the same type of equipment and the special materials for breaking the limit, <lf>equipment can be "broken through". <lf>The equipment with the limit breakthrough will have its status increased and can inherit the Special Effects and Abilities of <lf>the equipment with which it was <lf>selected.
Imagine Abbreviation
Each type of Imagine is referred to by the following abbreviations: <lf>E-Imagine: Enhance Imagine. Raises the adventurer's abilities. <lf>B-Imagine: Battle Imagine. Supports adventurers in battle. <lf>M-Imagine: Mount Imagine. Supports the movement of adventurers.
If you dispatch an M-Imagine in your possession with a "Mounted Caravan", you will receive a variety of items as a <lf>reward. <lf><lf>Mounted caravans can be accessed from the Pioneer Station.
ebb and flow
At Cape Rauwehara, the sea level rises and falls with the passage of time. <lf>There are places where you can go only when the tide is low or high. <lf>When walking along the sea, pay attention to the height of the sea level.
spiderwort (alias)
In Koaniani Forest there is a <lf>mysterious flower that reacts to certain gestures. <lf>The forest people seem to know what gestures it reacts to. <lf>If you can get them to tell you, try using them.
Trees of Koaniani Forest
Koaniani Forest has tree roots that expand and contract. <lf>Even paths that are blocked by roots during the day <lf>can be traversed at night as the roots shorten.
Switching the display of subtitles
Subtitles displayed during cutscenes can be toggled on and off at <lf><span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="DemoSubtitleGuide"/><span color="Action">] &lt;/&gt; <lf>
Stamina-consuming behavior
Evasion <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Dodge"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; and jumping <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Jump"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; and dashing <lf>during combat consume Stamina. <lf>Be aware that if you run out of Stamina, you will not be able to <lf>perform actions that consume Stamina.
You can always re-read the tutorial help displayed during play at <lf>command menu <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="CommandMenu"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; in the "Adventure Handbook" at <lf>"Travel Guide". <lf>It also contains basic knowledge about adventuring, such as class characteristics.
Adventurer rank 2 promotion test
In this exam, it is important not only to be well equipped, but also to <lf>have the wisdom to take advantage of the gimmicks in place to defeat the enemy. <lf><lf>Do not focus only on the enemy, but look carefully at your surroundings. <lf>
Adventurer rank 3 promotion test
In this test, a large number of "falling rocks" will fall from the ceiling. <lf>If you are hit by a falling rock, you will be stunned and in a pinch. <lf>It is effective to prepare equipment that is resistant to fainting as well as to avoid the falling rocks themselves. <lf> Try to avoid them. <lf>
Adventurer rank 6 promotion test
This test will feature <lf>"Numb Swamp," which will paralyze you if you set foot in it. <lf>If you have Paralysis Resistance equipment, you can withstand it, so <lf>make sure you are well equipped for the challenge. <lf>
Adventurer rank 8 promotion test
This time, it is a dangerous test in which HP is being cut off by "poison pools". <lf>While paying attention to the movement of characters by using skills and evasion, <lf>you need to have the courage to attack at once even if you Accept the poison when the situation calls for it. <lf>Fight while judging the situation.
When you can't complete a mission
If you are unable to complete a mission, raise your level or <lf>complete additional research missions to collect equipment. <lf>It is also recommended to further strengthen <lf>equipment by "breaking the limit" to collect the same equipment to make it stronger.
bomb dal
When "Blasting Dull" attacks, it explodes and damages the surrounding area. <lf>Lead the surrounding enemies to it and damage them all at once.
Flash Pot
The "Flash Pot" that emits light when attacked will <lf>put the enemy in a stun state for a certain period of time. <lf>Let's make it emit light at the right moment.
caves dug as tombs in and around Kamakura during the Kamakura and Muromachi periods
The "caves" can be destroyed by attacking them. <lf>Destroy the caves to make the enemies on top fall down.
Breakable wooden boxes, etc.
In some dungeons, there may be items, such as crates, that break when attacked <lf>. <lf>Breaking those items will rarely give you a luno or recover <lf>HP.
spike trap
Accept heavy damage if you touch a "spike trap. <lf>In the dungeon, be careful of your surroundings.
blind alley
There are several types of "no-passage traps," including ones where the fence is always out and impassable and those where the fence goes up and down at <lf>regular intervals. <lf>You cannot pass through while the fence is up, so be sure to <lf>time your passage.
spray trap
When you come in contact with the mist that the "Spray Trap" sprays out, <lf>you may be subjected to Paralysis or other dangerous abnormalities. <lf>It is possible to distinguish the abnormality by the color of the spray. <lf>First of all, avoid the spray so as not to be affected by the abnormalities.
Bulkhead and release switch
If the "bulkhead" is closed, you will not be able to pass through. <lf>There is a "release switch" somewhere, so look for it.
puddle of poison
If you pass over the "Poison Puddle," you will be affected by a poisonous condition and your <lf>HP will gradually decrease. Watch your step in the dungeon.
Supplier
This is an enhancement device installed in the dungeon. <lf>Use <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Interaction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; to temporarily increase your ability, so <lf>use it if you see it. <lf>There are various effects such as "ATK Up", "Speed Up", "Recovery Up", etc. <lf>
release switch
Look for clues and press the switches in sequence to open the bulkheads. <lf>Hints can be found by touching the lights in the various rooms. <lf>The hints you find can also be checked in the system log. <lf>Press the switches in the correct order to open the bulkhead. <lf>Also note that an Enemy will appear in case of failure.
It is an object that reinforces the entire Enemy. <lf>It can be destroyed by attacking it. <lf>If left behind, the Enemy will continue to be strengthened, so <lf>be proactive in destroying it.
Simple Transfer Portal
It is a device that the player moves to. <lf>Touching the portal instantly moves the player to another simple transfer portal <lf>.
The content is to protect the <lf>"Engram Wall" that surrounds the defense target from many enemies. <lf>You will win the game if the Engram Wall is not destroyed until the time limit <lf>is reached and you are able to defend it.
Adventurer rank 10 promotion test
This time, the "unlocking box" is the test. <lf>You can proceed by carrying the unlocking box to the pedestal. <lf>Your Stamina will gradually decrease while carrying the box. <lf>Stamina can be recovered by stopping at the spot, so <lf>keep an eye on your Stamina as you proceed.
lockbox
The "unlocking box" is a gimmick that opens a door by carrying a key. <lf>By carrying the key object and setting it on the pedestal, <lf>the door will open and you can proceed. <lf>If you can't find the key, try <lf>to find a place you haven't been to yet.
It is a device that summons Enemies one after another. <lf>As long as it is moving, the Enemy will be summoned at regular intervals. <lf>If you see one, destroy it with priority.
Adventurer rank 12 promotion test
This time there will be a <lf>gimmick that brings about a "Bind" condition that renders the adventurer immobile. <lf>The "Bind" condition can be prevented with "Anti-Bind", so let's equip E-Imagine with <lf>Anti-Bind.
The "Attack Checker" is a facility that allows you to measure <lf>how much damage you can do. <lf>You can measure <lf>damage with your current equipment and tactical skill combination and practice before taking on content. <lf>You can also use it with a party.
bog bog
Passing over the "Blunt Swamp" will slow down your movement speed. <lf>It will be difficult to avoid attacks from the Enemy, so either equip <lf>Resistance E-Imagine or <lf>avoid entering it if at all possible.
blowhole
You can fly high by riding on the "spouts" that are spewing out. <lf>Use it to move to higher places or <lf>to avoid attacks from enemies.
Laser Fence
If you touch the "Laser Fence", you will <lf>Accept damage or status abnormality. <lf>Depending on the height of the fence, you can avoid <lf>it by jumping or going under it.
beam cannon
Beams are fired at regular intervals. <lf>Accepting the beam will result in severe damage, so <lf>avoid the beam when you see the warning signs and try not to get hit.
It is a very difficult mission to conquer. <lf>This mission does not have a number of resurrections, so if you fail to rescue the victim, you will fail the mission as it is <lf>. <lf>If you successfully complete the mission, you will receive a mission-specific medal.
lamp door
The gimmick is to open the door by lighting all the lamps. <lf>To light a lamp, you must defeat the <lf>specific Enemy corresponding to each lamp.
time door
It is a gimmick that opens the door for a while by pressing the switch. <lf>While the door is open, the "guide light" from the switch to the door will be lit. <lf>Rely on the guide light to find the door.
Enemy Jammer
It is a device that can inflict <lf>debuffs such as sleep and stun on the enemy when interacted with. <lf>Use it when the time is right to fight to your advantage.
In this mission, if you pass over the "Poison Puddle", you will get <lf>poison status abnormality and your HP will decrease rapidly. <lf>Equip yourself with Resistance E-imagine or <lf>avoid entering it if at all possible.
spiked device that blows up when a bomb explodes
If you touch the "exploding spikes," they will explode and <lf>Accept damage. <lf>They cannot be destroyed by attacks, so <lf>try to stay away from them as much as possible.
enemy rush
Enemy Rush" is an event that occurs during a mission. <lf>Enemies appearing in the event tend to drop treasure chests, so <lf>try to kill as many of them as possible within the time limit!
protective heavenly shield
This is a mission-specific skill that consumes 50% of the "Mission Skill Gauge" and can nullify <lf>all attacks. <lf>Activate against powerful attacks or attacks that cannot be avoided. <lf><span color="Action">Activate the skill by pressing [&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="ContentAction2"/><span color="Action">] &lt;/&gt;. <lf>(You can extend the time of disablement by holding it down)
claw your teeth into a bullet
Hitting against certain attacks will <lf>force the Enemy to interrupt its action and <lf>increase the "Mission Skill Gauge" by a lot. <lf><span color="Action">Pressing [&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="ContentAction1"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; will activate the skill.
Training Ground of the God of War
This mission is extremely difficult to conquer and requires combat that makes full use of "mission-specific skills" <lf>. <lf>If you successfully complete the mission, you will receive a mission-specific medal.
Collection Spot
Plants, trees, rocks, and other items are glowing in areas where they can be collected. <lf>The items that can be collected are classified into three categories: "Plants," "Minerals," and "Aquatic" <lf>, and which type of items can be collected is indicated by an icon above the <lf>collection spot in advance. <lf>After a certain amount of time has passed, you can pick up the item again.
Let's walk around the field.
The map is covered in clouds at first, but <lf>the clouds will clear in places you have visited. <lf><lf>Also, creatures called "Happy Nappos" may be <lf>hiding in the field. If you find one, talk to it.
Pin usage
The pin at the top of the map screen is <lf>You can stick it in any location with a comment. <lf><lf>Use the pins effectively as landmarks.
Skill interval
Some skills will have an interval until <lf>they can be used again. <lf>Skills cannot be used during the interval.
Element Type
There are six types of Element: <lf>Fire, Ice, Lightning, Earth, Light, and Dark.
Element Status Abnormalities
By overlapping attacks with Elemental Charge accumulation values, <lf>you can cause an Elemental State Abnormality on the enemy. <lf>(Elemental Charge accumulation occurs even if attacks of different attributes are stacked.) <lf>State abnormalities include Lv1, 2, and Burst.
Recovering from a change of state
Most condition changes will heal naturally after a certain amount of time. <lf><lf>Be careful with condition changes that cause a gradual decrease in HP. <lf>If you run out of HP before it heals naturally, you will lose the ability to fight.
Enhance Imagine is an Imagine that <lf>improves the basic abilities of the adventurer. <lf>There are five symbols and each symbol can be equipped with <lf>one Enhance Imagine.
Stamina
Evasion <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Dodge"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; and jumping <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Jump"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; and dashing <lf>during combat consume Stamina. <lf>Stamina is automatically recovered over time. <lf><lf>Stamina is not consumed in towns such as Asterleeds.
Falling from a high place
Accept damage if you fall from a certain height in the field. <lf>If you fall from a higher height, you will lose the ability to fight. <lf><lf>Watch your step when moving or fighting in high places.
Mount Imagine is available in some fields and in the city. <lf><lf>Mount Imagine can be dashed <lf>by expending dash energy.
This is a mass participation battle that can be challenged by up to 30 people. <lf>Work together with other adventurers to defeat the mighty Raid Enemies. <lf><lf>Raid missions appear only during specific time periods.
engram cannon
The Engram Cannon is a <lf>special device that can be used in raid missions. <lf>It is immensely effective against enemies, so don't miss <lf>the right time to use it and use it aggressively!
Mission - Time limit
Each mission has a time limit. <lf>When the time limit is reached, the mission will end. <lf><lf>Please pay attention to the time limit as you proceed.
Mission - Battle Area
When a battle area occurs, a lock wall will appear. <lf>The lock wall will be released when the targeted enemy is destroyed.
If you achieve the conditions set for each floor, you will be able to use the <lf>transfer device and advance to the next floor. <lf><lf>You will receive a reward for each certain number of floors you advance, so try again and again <lf>and do your best to advance gradually to the next floor.
free search
Some dungeons can be re-entered on foot after the main quest to explore the dungeon with no <lf>time limit. <lf><lf>There are materials and special enemies that can only be obtained here. <lf>There are other players, so you can explore in cooperation with them.
This is a quest to learn the basics of <lf>classes with a class partner for each class. <lf>You will be given tips on how to play each class, so <lf>Accept it actively.
Engram is a generic term for the <lf>energy that all life in this world contains. <lf>Organisms obtain <lf>energy by activating engrams in their bodies. <lf>When an organism dies, the engram is absorbed by the earth's surface.
Some missions have Battle Score limits. <lf>If your Battle Score is insufficient, increase your Battle Score by <lf>equipping a new weapon or Enhance Imagine, or <lf>tuning or plugging in a weapon.
Some missions have Battle Score limits. <lf>If your Battle Score is insufficient, try <lf>crafting a new weapon or Battle Imagine, or <lf>increasing your class level to increase your Battle Score.
named enemy
These are special enemies that appear when certain conditions are met. <lf>They are considerably stronger than normal enemies, but if you <lf>defeat them, you have a certain probability of obtaining <lf>the Battle Imagine's Idea.
Combat and Rescue
If you revive yourself after losing a battle in a field or free exploration map, you will <lf>restart from a nearby revival point. <lf>If you are rescued by another player <lf>you can resurrect at the place where you fell and return to your adventure immediately.
matching
If you select "Apply for Matching" at the start of a mission, you can challenge <lf>missions with other players without <lf>partying. <lf>Feel free to try matching.
strongbox
Treasure chests that are appearing do not compete with other players <lf>and are assigned individually to each player. <lf>When you find a treasure chest, do not hesitate to open it.
Accepting the effects of Avaritia's "distortion," <lf>it is an Enemy that has gone berserk. <lf>It is characterized by a strange engram haze. <lf><lf>Flux uses the abbreviation "F".
Machina, proto-machina
It is a being created by mechanizing and modifying various Enemies <lf>through the technology of the Bapharia civilization. <lf>The prototype is called the proto-machina. <lf><lf>The abbreviation "M" is used for Machina and "PM" for Proto Machina.
Physical recovery in the field
In the field, if you are not found by the enemy and you are delivering the sword, <lf>HP will gradually recover. <lf>Recovery amount increases during the "sit" gesture, so when <lf>HP is depleted, sit down to recover HP.
Class Level Bonus
When your class level reaches a certain value and your expert rank increases, you will receive a class level bonus according to <lf>your expert rank. <lf><lf>The class level bonus for all classes is <lf>added to the parameters of the current class, so you can raise the levels of other classes as well.
mystery treasure
Even if opened once, these treasure chests are relocated at a fixed time each week. <lf>The locations where they appear and their contents are random.
Lucky State (Lucky Enemy)
Enemies in the "lucky state" will always drop <lf>materials and treasure chests. <lf>(In some cases, more than one treasure chest may be dropped.) <lf>When you find a "Lucky Enemy", be proactive in defeating it!
You can decorate your room on the second floor of the Coin Pavilion with ornaments and other furnishings. <lf>Place the furnishings of your choice and arrange your room to your liking. <lf>Furnishings can be obtained at the souvenir exchange.

expert rank
Current expert rank and bonuses earned
The increase in three parameters for each class according to expert rank is called the Class Level Bonus. <lf>Class level bonuses for all classes are added to the current class parameters. <lf>The Battle Build parameters show the value with the Class Level Bonus added.
Current Expert Rank

Expert Rank Up Conditions
The first time your expert rank is increased is when your class level reaches 50. <lf>After that, the expert rank will increase every time the class level increases by 10.

INFORMATION
Let's go back to the city by spatial transfer.
Spatial Transfer is a convenient feature that can Quick Cooldown travel time. <lf>You can instantly move from the command menu <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="CommandMenu"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; map to the <lf>city transfer portal. <lf>First, open the map screen of the command menu.
Battle Imagine for Battle Advantage
Let's immediately equip the "Battle Imagine" you just got <lf>in the <lf>command menu <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="CommandMenu"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; under "Character" &gt; "Battle Build". <lf>Battle Imagine has a variety of skills, including attack and recovery. <lf>Find the Battle Imagine that fits your battle style. <lf><lf>Once you have equipped your Battle Imagine, <lf>talk to "Myulie" at the Pioneer Station again. <lf>He will tell you how to become an adventurer.
Get ready for adventure!
This time, the expedition will take you to the edge of the "Skyquake Fields". <lf>Let's proceed by relying on the route guide and quest icons. <lf>It is also a good idea to try collecting at the collecting spots along the way. <lf><lf>There are also belligerent enemies in the field. <lf>To avoid getting hurt and falling down along the way, take out recovery medicine from the <lf>warehouse and put it in your bag. <lf>The warehouse is located at the end of the pioneering station, the girl at the asset management counter will guide you.
Let's build a weapon.
If you have the recipe from Reikrid Tunnels, you can craft <lf>a weapon by consuming materials and lunos at <lf>. <lf>Select "Weapon Crafting" in the sphere kneading ritual.
Have you used your new skills?
On the skill board in the command menu <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="CommandMenu"/><span color="Action">] &lt;/&gt;, you can check <lf>the skills you have learned. <lf>Once you have learned multiple skills, you can replace them in "Battle Build" <lf>and customize them to your liking to fight.
We got the weapon recipe.
Sometimes, such as when you complete a mission, you will get a recipe for a weapon or an Imagine from <lf>. <lf>With the recipes, you will be able to craft <lf>weapons, Battle Imagines, and Enhance Imagines. <lf>After registering as an adventurer, you can visit the "Transferring Sphere Crafting Ritual" in town.
Use of Wish List
The "Wish List" is a feature that notifies <lf>when materials are available for crafting and displays recipes on the main screen. <lf>Recipes can be added to the wish list from the crafting screen, etc., <lf>so be sure to add recipes you are interested in as you go. <lf><lf>You can also use the HUD to check the collection status at any time. <lf>Go to "Quest" &gt; "Wish List" in the command menu to display the <lf>list and check <lf>the checklist of recipes you wish to display on the HUD. <lf>Up to three lists can be displayed on the HUD at one time.
We have obtained a weapons board.
I got the recipe for the "Dragon Nail" series of weapons and the <lf>adventure board as rewards for the quest. <lf>The adventure board for weapons is an efficient way to collect materials for weapons by completing the <lf>assignments since the assignment rewards are materials for weapons. <lf>First, let's complete the assignments on the "Dragon Nail" board.
Materials for the "Dragon Claw Valley" series <lf>・Fossil of Giant Fang: reward for clearing "Dragon Claw Valley: Additional Research" <lf>・Goblin Fang: obtained by defeating goblins in "Dragon Claw Valley: Free Search" <lf>・Rings: obtained from mineral extraction points <lf>Only the fossil of Giant Fang cannot be obtained from the Adventure Board. <lf>Please go through "Dragon Claw Valley: Additional Investigations" to collect the materials.
Enemy Combination Technique
Enemies may work together in groups and use special techniques. <lf>If you see suspicious activity, make it a priority to defeat them.
Target - Attack
<span color="Action">You can attack by pressing [&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="MainAction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt;. <lf>(You can attack continuously by holding down the button.) <lf>When there is an Enemy nearby, press <span color="Action">【&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Lockon"/><span color="Action">】&lt;/&gt; to fix <lf>the target of the attack. <lf><lf>Use evasion <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Dodge"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; as well to fight while avoiding the attack. <lf>Avoiding <span color="Action">【&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Dodge"/><span color="Action">】&lt;/&gt; and jumping <span color="Action">【&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Jump"/><span color="Action">】&lt;/&gt; during battle consumes <lf>Stamina. <lf>Be aware that if you run out of Stamina, you will not be able to <lf>perform actions that consume Stamina.
<span color="Action">You can make your character jump <lf>with [&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Jump"/><span color="Action">] &lt;/&gt;. <lf>Jumping consumes Stamina only during combat.
The Route Guide will guide you to your 'next destination'. <lf>While the main quest is in progress, the main quest route guide has <lf>priority. <lf><span color="Action">While pressing [&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="dash"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt;, dash to <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Move"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; and use it to follow the <lf>route guide.
If you want to view route guides for other quests, go to <lf>command menu &gt; "Quests" &gt; "Ordered Quests" and select the quest for which you want to view <lf>route guides.
<span color="Action">While pressing [&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="dash"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt;, dash to <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Move"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt;. <lf>When you are in a non-combat state, you do not use Stamina, so take advantage of it.
Tactical skills can be activated by pressing <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Skill1"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; during combat. <lf>Tactical skills that can be activated vary by class. <lf>Most skills have an "interval". <lf>During the interval, the skill cannot be used, so <lf>use your Tactical Skill at the right time.
Interacting <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Interaction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; with a collection spot in the field will <lf>give you access to material items. <lf>There are various collection spots on the ground, rocks, etc. <lf>and the items that can be obtained at each spot are different. <lf><lf>Once you have collected an item, you will be able to collect it again <lf>after a certain amount of time has passed, so if you want to collect a lot of items, <lf>wait a while before visiting the spot again.
Once you have collected a spot, you will not be able to collect it for a while. <lf>After a certain amount of time has passed, or if you return to town, you may be able to collect it again. <lf> <lf>If you have exhausted the collection spots in the field, you can go back to the town <lf>.
Aegis Fighter Features
Aegis Fighter performs <lf>"Shield Guard" to hold the shield while <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="SubAction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; is pressed during combat. <lf>Accepting an enemy's attack during Shield Guard does not reduce HP, but <lf>instead decreases the "Shield Gauge", and when the gauge reaches 0, <lf>shield-related actions become unavailable for a while.
If you enter <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="MainAction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; immediately after guarding an attack, you can launch <lf>a powerful counter-slash.
Twin Striker Features
Twin Striker's <lf>"combo gauge" increases with each attack. <lf>The higher this gauge is, the more damage you can inflict. <lf>However, the gauge resets when you lose a certain amount of HP from Accepting an attack, so use <lf>evasion and HP absorption buffs to fight.
Blast Archer Features
Blast Archers can increase their <lf>"Buff Charge Gauge (BC Gauge)" and use the <lf>class action "Cure Arrow" by attacking. <lf>BC Gauge increases more when attacking a specific area of weakness or when a <lf>critical hit occurs, so depending on the situation <lf>lock-on <span color="Action">Use <lf>with or without [&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Lockon"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; depending on the situation, and attack aggressively.
Spell Caster Features
Spell Caster consumes EP and uses powerful skills. <lf>Since you can fire a series of powerful skills until you run out of EP, <lf>attack at once when the moment is right. <lf>EP is recovered by using <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="SubAction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; and some class skills, or after a certain amount of time in <lf>non-combat state.
Smasher Features
If the Heavy Smasher has ammunition remaining in the cartridge, it can attack with various skills by expending <lf>number of bullets. <lf>The number of bullets consumed depends on the skill. <lf>You can reload with <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="SubAction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; after using all bullets, but you can also reload with <lf>remaining bullets by pressing and holding <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="SubAction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt;. <lf><lf>Reloading with all ammunition used is a quick reload and will <lf>reload faster and with two more rounds. <lf>Manage your ammunition count and make the most of the quick reload.
transfer portal
Using the "Transfer Portals" located in various parts of the city and in the field, you can move instantly between <lf>each transfer portal by spatial transfer. <lf>You need to register your portal to use it, so when you find <lf>a new portal, register the <lf>portal at <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Interaction"/><span color="Action">] &lt;/&gt;.
Transfer Portal Registration
Delivery recipients will be waiting near the transfer portals, so <lf>register any portals you have not yet registered. <lf>Portals can be used for travel within the city, and you can also return directly to <lf>each portal from outside the city, making your adventure easier.
The asset management office takes care of the adventurer's assets. <lf><lf>Warehouses can store items, weapons, costumes, etc., and <lf>can also sell items that are no longer needed. <lf>Items that are not used during the adventure, such as material items, are <lf>automatically sent to the warehouse when they are acquired. <lf><lf>You can also use "Battle Build" to change your character's equipment <lf>. <lf>Before going on an adventure, it is a good idea to stop by to organize your bag.
In the "Rush Battles" held in the Arena, winning rewards such as ability plugs that can be used to enhance <lf>weapons. <lf>Multiple difficulty levels are available, and the higher the <lf>difficulty, the better the rewards.
If there is a difficulty level you cannot complete, go to <lf>"Missions" in the command menu to complete other missions and craft <lf>new weapons. <lf>Equip yourself with a powerful weapon to make it easier to conquer.
The content allows players to compete with other players in terms of time to clear the game. <lf>Also, special rewards will be awarded for each time you beat the specified time. <lf>Let's try again and again by preparing your weapons and Enhance Imagine. <lf><lf>Time attack rankings can be found on the "Ranking Board" located at <lf>throughout the city.
At the Imagine Laboratory, you can craft <lf>Enhance Imagines (E-Imagines) and other Imagines by consuming materials and Lunos. <lf>E-Imagines can be equipped to increase parameters and also enhance the adventurer with <lf>granted abilities. <lf><lf>E-Imagines come in the form of five different symbols. <lf>The E-Imagine we are going to create is the "Three Leaves" symbol. <lf>You can equip one E-Imagine for each symbol, so when you get <lf>a new E-Imagine recipe, <lf>pay attention to the shape (symbol) of that Imagine.
When certain conditions are met on the field, <lf>"Challenge Quests" will occur and Named Enemies will appear. <lf>There are <lf>various conditions for appearance, such as continuing to hunt a specific Enemy or appearing only at night. Please try to find them. <lf><lf>Also, when you defeat Named Enemies, you may be able to obtain <lf>"Idea". <lf>Collect "Idea" and other materials to craft "Battle Imagine" <lf>and summon once powerful enemies to advance the battle.
Crafting Battle Imagine
To craft a Battle Imagine, you will need <lf>specific materials for each Imagine. <lf>First, you will need the "Idea" of that Imagine, but <lf>you may also need other materials that you can get from collecting or defeating the Imagine.
Imagine's Abilities
Crafting an Imagine may grant <lf>abilities. <lf>The effect values of the abilities that may be granted and their probability are <lf>fixed for each Imagine's abilities.
Battle Rock Wall
The battlelock wall that holds players back in the dungeon can be <lf>removed by defeating certain enemies and other conditions <lf>to proceed. <lf>If you are unable to proceed, try defeating the surrounding enemies.
Some of the player's attacks have Elements attached to them. <lf>There are six types of Element: Fire, Ice, Thunder, Earth, Light, and Dark. <lf>By stacking attacks with Element, <lf>the player can cause an attribute anomaly on the enemy.
Elemental Charge accumulation occurs each time an Enemy is hit with an Elemental Attack, and when the Elemental Charge accumulation exceeds a certain amount <lf>, the Elemental State Abnormality of the most common attribute is triggered. <lf>(Elemental Charge accumulation occurs even if the attacker hits with a different attribute.) <lf>Elemental Charge accumulation occurs in three stages: Lv1, Lv2, and Burst. <lf>The further the stage advances, the more effective it becomes.
<span color="Emphasis">Fire Element State Abnormality&lt;/&gt; <lf>At Lv 1 and 2, the user is engulfed in flames and their HP gradually decreases. <lf>When it becomes a Fire Burst, a small explosion occurs when the burst occurs, and <lf>a large explosion occurs at the Burst Finish, inflicting heavy Damage Burst.
<span color="Emphasis">Ice Element State Abnormality&lt;/&gt; <lf>Lv1,2 causes the target to be covered in ice and movement speed is reduced. <lf>When in Ice Burst, the target is covered in a block of ice and cannot move when a burst occurs, and the <lf>burst finish causes the ice block to explode, inflicting heavy Damage Burst.
<span color="Emphasis">Thunder Element State Abnormality&lt;/&gt; <lf>At Lv 1 and 2, an electric current runs through the body, impeding action at a certain probability. <lf>In a lightning burst, a small explosion occurs when the burst occurs, and <lf>a large explosion occurs when the burst finishes, <lf>inflicting large Damage Burst and Paralysis at the same time.
<span color="Emphasis">Earth Element State Abnormality&lt;/&gt; <lf>At Lv 1 and 2, clumps of earth cling to the body, increasing Damage Received. <lf>When it becomes an Earth Burst, it is covered in clods of earth and cannot move when a burst occurs, and the <lf>Burst Finish causes the clods to explode, inflicting heavy Damage Burst.
<span color="Emphasis">Light Element State Abnormality&lt;/&gt; <lf>At Lv 1 and 2, the player is covered in Light and the Damage Dealt is reduced. <lf>When it becomes a Light Burst, a small explosion occurs when the burst occurs, <lf>and a large explosion occurs when the burst finishes, <lf>causing large Damage Burst as well as continuous HP recovery to the surrounding players.
<span color="Emphasis">Dark Element State Abnormality&lt;/&gt; <lf>At Lv 1 and 2, Darkness clings to the user and <lf>causes the attack to miss with a certain probability. <lf>When it goes into Darkness Burst, a small explosion occurs when the burst occurs, <lf>and a large explosion occurs when the burst finishes, <lf>causing large Damage Burst and an HP leak condition at the same time.
signs of an attack
Some enemies have predictable attacks. <lf>When the predicted area of attack appears, that is where the attack will come from. <lf>Basically, focus on avoidance.
Gestures to other players
You can gesture toward <lf>other players by gesturing from the Communicate menu.
CRIME
Some walls can be climbed. <lf>To climb a wall, go up to the wall and enter <lf><span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Interaction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; to hold onto the wall. <lf>Enter <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="MoveFront"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; to climb. <lf><lf>The places where you can climb are indicated by icons on the minimap. <lf>If you cannot find the way forward, try to find it.
Supplied items
During the mission, you will not be able to use items in your bag, only the supplied items that you receive from the <lf>pioneer station. <lf>Supplied items can be used in the item palette or registered in the <lf>shortcut ring. <lf>Remaining supplied items will be collected at the end of the dungeon. <lf><lf>Some missions allow you to use items in your bag.
The Engram Cannon is a legacy of Bapharia that aggregates surrounding engrams and fires them at <lf>the enemy. <lf>It is immensely effective against enemies. <lf>When glowing blue-white, it can be used for boarding. <lf>When glowing red, it is charging and cannot be used. <lf><lf>■Operation <lf>Getting in and out: <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Interaction"/><span color="Action">] &lt;/&gt; <lf>Adjusting the firing direction: <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="CameraControl"/><span color="Action">] &lt;/&gt; <lf>Firing: <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="MainAction"/><span color="Action">] &lt;/&gt; <lf>Be aware that you will Accept damage if attacked while boarding.
You can also receive quests from quest receptionists and people in town. <lf><lf>If you want to display route guides other than the main quest, go to <lf>"Quests" &gt; "Ordered Quests" in the command menu and check the "Show in HUD" box and the <lf>"Show Route Guide" radio button for the quest for which you want to display a guide.
Quest Exclusive Items
Quest-specific items are <lf>special items that can only be obtained during certain quest orders. <lf>They do not go into your bag or warehouse and cannot be sold. <lf>You can only see how many you have in your quest journal or HUD display. <lf>Please note that when you discard a quest, the quest-specific item will also be discarded and you will have to start collecting it all over again <lf>even if you re-accept the quest. <lf>
About Classes
In the command menu "Character" &gt; "Battle Build" you can <lf>switch to another type of weapon to equip <lf>class change. <lf>Class change can be done in the city, field, and free exploration map. <lf>(You cannot change classes while being viewed as an enemy.) <lf><lf>In addition, "Class Quests" can now be ordered. <lf>You can learn about <lf>classes with a class partner chosen for each class, so <lf>whether you are adventuring in your current class or changing classes, <lf>you should first Accept the Class Quest at the Pioneer Station.
More Content
This is the end of the main quest. <lf>From now on, please look for the various contents that exist in each area and enjoy playing at <lf>.
In addition, if you are not sure what to do, talk to the receptionist at the <lf>pioneer station. <lf>Subquests of recommended levels will lead you to <lf>new content.
How to do the gesture
You can take <lf>gestures by selecting the gesture you want to do from the talk mode <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="ChatMode"/><span color="Action">] &lt;/&gt; or by calling the gesture registered in the <lf>shortcut. <lf>Communicate with other adventurers using gestures.
Enhance Imagine's equipment
Enhance Imagine increases ability values when equipped, increases resistance to debuffs through a special effect called <lf>Ability, and reduces damage from <lf>Element attacks. <lf><lf>Go to "Character" &gt; "Battle Build" in the command menu to equip <lf>"Enhance Imagine".
Enhance Imagine increases ability values when equipped, increases resistance to debuffs through a special effect called <lf>Ability, and reduces damage from <lf>Element attacks. <lf>Go to "Character" &gt; "Battle Build" in the command menu to equip <lf>"Enhance Imagine".
When the level of equipment, such as Enhance Imagine, is high, <lf>there is a possibility of "level sync" being applied to each. <lf>Level sync" on equipment means that when the equipment level is higher than the <lf>player's class level, <lf>the equipment's parameters are temporarily restricted. <lf>(E-uri Uribo will start to show its true value at class level 5) <lf><lf>If the player's class level is equal to the equipment level <lf>, the full power of the equipment will be available. <lf>When you get strong equipment but do not feel that you are getting stronger, you can try <lf>raising your class level.
The Enhance Imagine crafted this time is of a high level, so there is a possibility that it will be in a state of "level sync" when <lf>equipped. <lf>Level sync" means that when the level of the <lf>equipment is higher than the player's class level, the equipment's parameters are temporarily <lf>restricted. <lf>(E-uri Uribo will show its true value from class level 5.) If the <lf><lf>player's class level is equal to the equipment level, the full power of <lf>the equipment will be available. <lf>When you get strong equipment but do not feel that you are getting stronger, you should try <lf>raising your class level.
Enhance Imagines come in the form of five different symbols, and you can equip only one Imagine of each <lf>symbol. <lf>When you get a new recipe, <lf>pay attention to the shape of its Enhance Imagine.
Adventurer Rank Up Board
Congratulations, you are now registered with the Pioneer Bureau as an adventurer. <lf>However, you are still a novice adventurer. <lf>First, let's advance the tasks listed on the "Adventure Board" <lf>and raise your adventurer rank. <lf><lf>You can switch between <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="QuestHudChange"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; the list of ordered quests on the HUD <lf>ordered quests, wish list and adventure board <lf>each time you press [&lt;/&gt; ]&lt;/&gt;. <lf>Display the assignments you wish to proceed with now.
Congratulations, you are now registered with the Pioneer Bureau as an adventurer. <lf>However, you are still a novice adventurer. <lf>First, you will need to advance the tasks listed on the "Adventure Board" <lf>to raise your Adventurer rank. <lf><lf>The tasks on the board that are not connected by lines from the start are tasks that can be completed at any time while the <lf>board is in progress. <lf>There are also completion rewards for completing all the tasks, so <lf>be proactive in advancing your tasks.
You can also Accept "Subquests" from people in town or from the Pioneer Bureau receptionist at <lf>. Accepting subquests from <lf>the Pioneering Bureau is also a good idea, as the Adventure Board and subquests can be <lf>pursued in parallel.
