Raise your Adventurer Rank!
To get Jake to introduce you to a new job, go to <lf>First, proceed with the Adventure Board assignment you were given. <lf>The last assignment is an exam (battle) Accepted by Myulie. <lf>Make sure you have the right weapons and Enhance Imagine to take the test and raise your <lf>adventurer rank!
Additional Elements of Weapons
Weapon Crafting - Additional Elements
Some weapons have "Special Effects". <lf>For example, if a weapon has a "Goblin" Special Effect, it will do more damage to <lf>goblins.
In crafting, a weapon may be given a "Special Effect". <lf>For example, if a weapon has a "Goblin-type" Special Effect, it will do more damage to <lf>Goblin-type energies.
Some weapons also have "sockets". <lf>Up to four sockets can be added, and items called <lf>ability plugs can be attached to as many sockets as there are sockets. <lf><lf>The ability plugs allow you to add <lf>abilities to the weapon, such as "ATK Up".
Weapons that are crafted will also have "sockets" attached to them. <lf>Up to four sockets can be added, and items called <lf>ability plugs can be attached to as many sockets as there are sockets. <lf><lf>With the ability plugs, you can add <lf>abilities to your weapons, such as ATK Up.
The weapon we crafted this time has a Fire "Element". <lf>Even attacks without Element, such as normal attacks, can inflict more damage than usual on <lf>enemies with Fire as their weak point. <lf><lf>The damage indicator changes when you attack the weakest Element, so <lf>pay attention to the enemy's weakest Element as well.
Display of search range
In some quests, such as defeating a designated enemy or searching for something, a circular search area may appear on the <lf>mini-map. <lf>Aim at that search area first. <lf>In addition, more than one search area may be displayed at a time.
Tutorial Help
Some tutorial help can be read over and over in the <lf>"Travel Guide" in the "Adventure Handbook" in the <lf>command menu <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="CommandMenu"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt;. <lf>You can also find basic adventurer knowledge in the handbook, <lf>if you need help or want to know something.
Minimap and Layer Map
The main screen shows a round mini-map. <lf>The arrow in the center is the character, and the direction the arrow is pointing <lf>represents the direction you are currently facing. <lf>Other locations such as quests, stores, and portals are also shown with <lf>icons. <lf><lf>In addition, pressing <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="wholeMap"/><span color="Action">] &lt;/&gt; will display a layer map. <lf>(Pressing it again hides the layer map.) <lf>layer map also allows you to see the position of characters, etc., but you can see a larger area at once than <lf>. <lf>You can use it differently depending on the situation.
inability to fight
If your character is disabled in combat, you will not be able to <lf>move from that spot. <lf>If you lose combat, press and hold <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Interaction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; and return to the <lf>resurrection point. <lf><lf>Some missions have a limited number of resurrections. <lf>If other players rescue you, the number of times you can revive will not be reduced. <lf>If you become unable to fight, call out with a stamp <lf>and ask them to help you.
The currency in this world is called 'Lunos'. <lf>By spending Lunos, you can Accept <lf>services in the city, such as purchasing items. <lf>Lunos can be obtained from quest rewards and selling items. <lf>Items can be sold at the "Asset Management Desk".
Mounted Imagine can be equipped at <lf>"Character" &gt; "Costume/Mount" &gt; "Mounted Imagine" in the command menu at <lf>. <lf>After equipping it, you can mount it at <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="ImagineMount"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt;.
You can dash with <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Dash"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; while mounted. <lf>While dashing in the field, your dash gauge will decrease <lf>and you will not be able to dash when the gauge runs out. <lf>The gauge will recover in a certain amount of time, so when the gauge runs out, <lf>refrain from dashing for a while. <lf><lf>Some interactions <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Interaction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; are restricted while mounted.
At the memory stand, "Liquid Memory Effects" can be obtained by drinking <lf>drinks with activated liquid memory. <lf>Liquid memory effects can be various, such as "increase in the number of pieces obtained when collecting. <lf>The effect will <lf>disappear after a certain number of actions or after a certain amount of time, but it can be very useful.
Liquid memory can have multiple bottles of the same effect and <lf>be drunk at once to increase the number of uses and the amount of effect. <lf>In addition, multiple liquid memory effects can be obtained at the same time. <lf><lf>Liquid memory is activated <lf>when you perform certain actions that are determined for each bottle. <lf>It is also activated slowly over time, so you can check <lf>when you restart the game, for example.
Liquid memory effect 1
Increased number of materials collected <lf>This liquid memory has the effect of increasing the number of materials obtained from <lf>collection. <lf>The conditions for activation are the defeat of an enemy in the field and the passage of time.
Liquid memory effect 2
Quick Cooldown of Collection Time <lf>This liquid memory has the effect of <lf>increasing the speed of collection and reducing the time it takes to collect. <lf>The conditions for activation are mission completion and the passage of time.
Liquid memory effect 3
Discounted costs for commercial establishments <lf>This liquid memory has the effect of discounting the luno when using <lf>the shop. <lf>The conditions for activation are completion of main quest missions and <lf>passage of time.
Liquid memory effect 4
Increased Item Sale <lf>This liquid memory has the effect of <lf>increasing the sale price of items and equipment in the warehouse. <lf>The conditions for activation are drinking Liquid Memory and the passage of time.
Liquid memory effect5
Increased Drop Rate from Enemies <lf>This liquid memory has the effect of increasing the material item drop rate from <lf>enemies. <lf>The conditions for activation are collection and the passage of time.
Liquid memory effect 6
GC increase for mission rewards <lf>This liquid memory has the effect of increasing the amount of GC earned when <lf>completing a mission. <lf>The conditions for activation are Arena mission completion and the passage of time.
Effect of Liquid Memory7
Weapon Crafting Luno Discount <lf>This liquid memory has the effect of making <lf>Luno cheaper when crafting weapons. <lf>The conditions for activation are enemy defeat and the passage of time.
Liquid memory effect 8
Increased Team Experience <lf>This liquid memory has the effect of increasing <lf>the amount of team experience gained. <lf>The conditions for activation are completion of main quest missions and <lf>passage of time.
Liquid memory effect 9
Increased Enemy Experience <lf>This liquid memory has the effect of <lf>increasing <lf>class experience when defeating enemies in the field up to a certain level. <lf>The conditions for activation are collection and the passage of time. <lf><lf>Depending on the grade and the player's class level, <lf>the amount of experience increase varies as follows: <lf>Grade 1: Up to class level 30 Experience 2.2x <lf>Class level 31 and above Experience 1.1x
? Icon
?" icon for help. <lf>The help is located at <lf>in the upper right corner of the command menu screen and as a supplementary explanation for each operation screen, so if you have any questions, press it.
Battle Score is a measure of a character's <lf>strength, calculated by the character's equipment, Expert Rank, <lf>equipment Special Effects, Abilities, and Limit Breakthrough Value. <lf>Some missions require a certain level of Battle Score to <lf>participate. <lf><lf>You can increase your <lf>battle score by changing to stronger equipment, increasing your expert rank, <lf>enhancing your equipment by plugging in, breaking limits, tuning, etc.
It is a measure of a player's <lf>strength, calculated by the level of equipment the player is equipped with. <lf>Some missions require a certain level of battle score to <lf>participate.
When a character's Battle Score exceeds a certain value, <lf>the weapon will display an aura. <lf>There are six levels of weapon auras depending on the battle score. <lf>Increase your battle score and show off your weapon aura. <lf><lf>*The battle score at which the <lf>weapon aura switches changes at the timing when the maximum class level is raised.
To increase your battle score, you must change your <lf>equipment to a higher level. <lf>Also, if your own class level is lower than the level of the equipment <lf>, a level sync will occur, temporarily lowering the parameters of the equipment. <lf>If the level of the equipment is higher than your class level <lf>, raising your class level will increase your battle score.
parameter
Classes other than Spell Caster and Beat Performer <lf>STR ...... affects Attack, Defense, and Crit Damage <lf>DEX...affects HP and Defense <lf>DEX...affects ATK and Crit Rate <lf>INT ...... Recovery <lf>MND...affects Recovery and Concentration <lf><lf>Concentration Rate...affects the chance of a Crit Damage <lf>Concentration...affects the damage of a Critical Hit damage of a critical hit ()
Classes other than Spell Caster and Performer <lf>STR ...... affects Attack, Defense, and Crit Damage <lf>DEX...affects HP and Defense <lf>DEX...affects ATK and Crit Rate <lf>INT. ...... Recovery <lf>MND...affects Recovery and Concentration <lf><lf>Concentration Rate...affects the chance of a Crit Damage <lf>Concentration...affects the damage of a Critical Hit damage of a critical hit
■ Spell Caster, Beat Performer <lf>Muscle Strength ...... Affects Defense <lf>Durability...Affects HP, Defense <lf>Dexterity...Affects Crit Rate <lf>Intelligence... ...affects Attack, Recovery, and Conviction <lf>MND...affects Attack, Recovery, and Conviction <lf><lf>Conviction Rate...affects the probability of a Crit hit <lf>Conviction Rate...affects the damage of a Critical Hit damage of a critical hit.
■ Spell Caster, Performer <lf>STR ...... Affects Defense <lf>Durability...Affects HP, Defense <lf>Dexterity...Affects Crit Rate <lf>INT... ...affects Attack, Recovery, and Conviction <lf>MND...affects Attack, Recovery, and Conviction <lf><lf>Conviction Rate...affects the probability of a Crit hit <lf>Conviction Rate...affects the damage of a Critical Hit damage of a critical hit.

Costumes do not affect status or parameters, so <lf>get your favorite outfit and <lf>dress your character as you wish.

In the "Wallet," you can view the <lf>currency and tickets you have acquired during your previous adventures. <lf>Currency and tickets that have expired are also displayed, so be careful not to let them <lf>expire next time.
Quests checked from the list of "Ordered Quests" will be displayed on the <lf>HUD. <lf>To display the route guide for a quest, go to <lf>and click on the <lf>"Route Guide" radio button for the quest you wish to display the guide for. <lf><lf>If you have Accepted too many Quests, you can "Discard" them at <lf>. <lf>If you discard a quest, you will have to start over from the beginning. <lf>You can use it when you really want to Accept another sub-quest.

Weekly quests will be updated at <lf>every Thursday at %-H. <lf>Steady and weekly accumulation will lead to growth! <lf><lf>*Date and time of updates are subject to change.
Seasonal Quests are available at <lf>Seasonal Quests will change every season. <lf>Challenge yourself before the season switches!
Seasonal Quests are available at <lf>Seasonal Quests will change each season. <lf>Challenge them before the season switches! <lf>If you have the Royal Pass or Advanced Pass, you will be able to order <lf>more types of Seasonal Quests.
Bonus Quests are quests that are available during <lf>specific events. <lf>There are rewards and other benefits that can only be earned during the <lf>period, so don't forget to challenge them.
You can view an overall map of the areas you have visited so far. <lf><lf>Press the Map List button at the top of the screen to see <lf>a list of the regions you have visited so far. <lf>Select the region you want to go to and you will see a map of that region, icons of facilities and <lf>registered transfer portals. <lf>Select the portal you wish to visit and you will be transferred to that portal.
The map is covered with clouds, so that areas you have not been to are not <lf>visible. <lf><lf>You can also put pins with comments on the places you are interested in.
You can check your character's class level and ID. <lf>You can also edit comments, select photos you want to show other players, <lf>change titles and medals, and set up exchanges for adventurer cards. <lf>You can also customize your cards by setting your own photos on them, changing the frame, background <lf>, and so on. <lf>Parts for customization are available at <lf>the souvenir exchange as well as the ones you have from the beginning.
You can see <lf>information about characters with whom you have exchanged adventurer cards or adventured together. <lf><lf>■Friend List <lf>This is a list of characters with whom you have exchanged adventurer cards. <lf>You can solicit parties and have private talks from here. <lf>You cannot solicit parties from characters who are currently using certain functions. <lf><lf>Waiting List <lf>This is a list of characters who have sent you their Adventurer Cards. <lf>Send your Adventurer Card and become friends with them.

You can check the letters sent to you. <lf>Log-in bonuses and items purchased at the Regnus Store will also be sent to you via <lf>Letters, so be sure to check them often. <lf>Some letters can be forwarded to friends or your other characters. <lf>Please note that once you receive an item attached to a letter, you will no longer be able to forward it to <lf>. <lf><lf>Also, since there is a limit to the number of letters you can hold, it is a good idea to organize your letters by deleting <lf>unnecessary ones and receiving items from them frequently.

The "Adventure Board" is a board that allows you to receive <lf>various rewards for completing the tasks presented to you. <lf><lf>On the board detail screen, you can decide whether or not to proceed with the board and choose whether or not to display it on the <lf>main screen. <lf><lf>You will also receive a "Goal Reward" for completing the goal tasks on the board, and a "Complete Reward" for completing all <lf>tasks, so don't forget to <lf>receive them.
You can advance more than one board at a time, and you can choose <lf>which board to advance by going to "Quests" &gt; "Adventure Boards" in the <lf>command menu. <lf>(Boards of limited duration can be advanced regardless of the number of boards.)
■General <lf>You can switch from keyboard operation to controller operation and <lf>change the resolution and other general game settings. <lf>■Operation Settings <lf>Allows you to change the operation keys and controller button layout. <lf><lf>Bookmark registration screen registration and deletion: <lf><span color="Action">【&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="BookMarkRegist" operateMode="MouseAndKeyboard"/><span color="Action">】&lt;/&gt; (keyboard only) <lf>By pressing the above key on any screen in the command menu, you can register and delete <lf>bookmarks. <lf>The registered screen will appear immediately after the key is pressed.
■Sound <lf>Adjust the volume of background music and voices. <lf>■Graphics <lf>Sets the picture quality, such as low or high quality. <lf>■HUD <lf>Change the position of the mini-map and other items displayed on the main screen.
This rank indicates the competence of the adventurers registered with the Pioneer Bureau. <lf>To raise your adventurer rank, you must complete the <lf>adventure board assignments distributed by the Pioneer Bureau. <lf>Once you have completed all of the board's assignments, talk to Myulie to have your <lf>rank raised. <lf><lf>In some cases, the final assignment on the rank up board is an exam. <lf>In that case, remember to go to <lf>Myulie so you can Accept the exam from Myulie.
You can view and edit the information of the weapon or imager you are currently equipped with. <lf>By pressing the icon for a weapon, skill, class ability, etc., you can change it to <lf>another piece of equipment or ability. <lf>You can also hover the cursor over an icon to view its details. <lf>There are times when you may not be able to change equipment, such as during battle.
Weapons: Each class uses different weapons, and you can change classes by equipping <lf>weapons from other classes. <lf>Skill Palette: Tactical skills, Battle Imagines, etc. can be registered and used in battle at <lf>. <lf>Skill details can be viewed on the skill board. <lf><lf>Class Abilities: You can set up abilities that make the most of a class's features or compensate for its shortcomings. <lf> <lf>Shared slots are slots that can be used to set abilities learned in other classes. <lf>Enhance Imagine: Equipment that boosts a character's parameters. <lf>It is classified into five symbols, and up to five can be equipped.
On the "Wish List" screen, you can browse <lf>recipes that you have registered on the Craft screen, etc., and see how many material items you currently have and <lf>the main ways to obtain them. <lf>You can also select which recipes you want to display on the main screen.
You can view the photos you have taken and <lf>select photos to be placed on your Adventurer Card. <lf>There is a limit to the number of photos that can be stored in an album. <lf>Photos that exceed the limit will be deleted from oldest to newest.

With the Season Pass, you can earn various rewards by completing "Season Pass Quests" and accumulating <lf>Season Points. <lf>When you accumulate 100 points, your Season Rank will increase by 1, and you will receive <lf>the rewards designated for that rank. <lf>(Some rank rewards are exclusive to Royal Pass purchasers.) <lf>Ranks can also be raised by going to the Regnus Store from the "Buy Ranks" button and exchanging <lf>for Rose Orbs. <lf><lf>Purchasing the paid "Royal Pass" will give you <lf>exclusive rewards for the Royal Pass, as well as <lf>unlimited use of esthetic courses during the season.
Use the season points you receive for completing delivery quests to <lf>raise your season rank and receive rewards. <lf>Season ranks can be raised <lf>by clicking the "Rank Up" button in the upper right corner of the screen. You can also raise your rank in exchange for <lf>rose orbs by clicking the "Buy Rank" button in the upper left corner of the screen. <lf><lf>When you raise your rank, you will get rewards according to your rank. <lf>You can also exchange <lf>items for season points at <lf>"Season Store" once your season rank has reached a certain level.
There are two types of season passes: the <lf>free "Basic Pass" that all characters have, and the <lf>paid "Advanced Pass" and "Royal Pass" that are purchased later. <lf>Obtaining a paid pass will add paid-only quests to the Daily, Weekly, and <lf>Season Quests during the season. <lf><lf>You will earn <lf>Season Points for completing each quest during the season, and you will earn more <lf>Season Points if you have the paid pass.
*You can only upgrade to a paid pass once per season. <lf>Please note that you can only upgrade from the Basic Pass to either the Advanced Pass or the Royal Pass <lf>. <lf>(Whether you purchase the Advanced Pass or the Royal Pass <lf>does not change the paid-only quests that will be added)

Imagine Craft
At the Imagine Laboratory, you can craft <lf>Battle Imagines and Enhance Imagines by consuming materials and Lunos. <lf>Equipping each Imagine will increase its parameters as well as <lf>the effects of the Imagine's abilities.
Materials and lunos are consumed to create items and weapons. <lf>Recipes," which describe what materials are needed, can be obtained from <lf>adventure boards, quests, and mission rewards, as well as <lf>special material items. <lf><lf>Once you have a recipe on your wish list, you can check the status of your material item collection in the command menu or on the <lf>main screen. <lf>Register the recipes you want to make in your wish list.
Attach an ability plug to a weapon with an empty socket so that the <lf>weapon will have the ability effect. <lf>You can attach ability plugs for as many empty sockets as you have available.
By bringing in an activated liquid memory and having it become a drink, the <lf>Liquid Memory effect can be triggered. <lf>Multiple liquid memories can be activated at once.
You can exchange GC and other tokens for costumes and items. <lf>Dress up your character by exchanging your favorite outfits. <lf>There are also limited time memorabilia, so be sure to check the exchange office frequently.

You can check the members belonging to the team and their permissions. <lf>You can also change permissions from the gear icon. <lf>There are four types of <lf>privileges: leader, subleader, assistant, and member.
■Leader <lf>can perform all operations related to <lf>teams, such as changing the team name, disbanding the team, and approving membership applications. <lf>(The leader can dissolve the team, but cannot withdraw from the team. <lf>If you want to withdraw from a team, please transfer the leadership to another member. <lf><lf>■Sub Leader <lf>Can use functions other than disbanding and renaming a team. <lf><lf>■Assistants <lf>Can recruit to a team and approve applications to join.
*If a leader has not logged in for more than 30 days, the member can take over leadership privileges from <lf>Anyone can take over leadership privileges from the gear symbol.
You can check the team's activity log.
You can check the rank of the team you currently belong to. <lf>You can gain <lf>team experience by defeating enemies in the field, <lf>foraging, and crafting equipment while you are a member of a team. <lf><lf>When the team experience reaches a certain value, the team rank will increase and the number of <lf>members in the team will increase.
Weapon Limit Breakthroughs
You can "break the limit" of a weapon by using the same weapon as a material <lf>in the transferring ball training ceremony. <lf><lf>The equipment with the limit breakthrough will have higher status and can inherit the Special Effects and Ability Plugs of <lf>the equipment with which it is used as material. <lf><lf>In some cases, special auxiliary materials are required for breaking the limit. <lf>If you fail to break the limit, you will lose the auxiliary materials and Luno, but you will not lose <lf>the weapon, so keep trying to break the limit and <lf>train your weapon.
plug tuning
tuning
Changes the accuracy of abilities plugged into a weapon. <lf>If multiple ability plugs are attached to a single weapon, <lf>abilities that you wish to keep their effect values as is can be 'kept' at their effect values using <lf>tickets.
plug removal
Remove the installed ability plug and empty the socket. <lf><lf>Use the "Ability Plug Recovery Ticket" to have the <lf>ability plug removed for reuse.
Socket Expansion
Add more sockets to weapons to allow <lf>more ability plugs to be fitted. <lf><lf>Up to four sockets can be added to a single weapon.
Special Effect Tuning
The Special Effects of a weapon can be changed. <lf>(The effect may be reduced as a result of the change.) <lf>Special Tickets can be used to <lf>only draw Special Effects of the current rarity or higher, or to <lf>increase the effect value by one level.
title selection
Set the title that is being displayed to the Adventurer Card. <lf>Only one title can be displayed at a time, so when the button is turned on <lf>the title that was previously set will be removed.
Title to be displayed on the Adventurer Card
You can choose which titles to display on your Adventurer Card. <lf>Titles can be earned mainly by completing achievements. <lf>You can see what achievements are available at <lf>"Adventure Notebook" in the command menu.
fishing
To fish, first cast <lf>bait at <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="MainAction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; and wait for a fish. <lf>When a fish comes by, hook <lf>with <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="MainAction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; at the right time. <lf>Once you have hooked the fish, reel in <lf>with <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="MainAction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt;. <lf>If you can pull the fish close to you, you can catch it.
Line tension increases as the fish gets out of control. <lf>When line tension reaches 100%, the fish will run away. <lf>Reduce line tension by pulling the tip of your fishing rod <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="MoveLeft"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; or <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="MoveRight"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; closer to the <lf>fish. <lf>*If the tension is at 0%, the fish will escape. <lf><lf>The fish you catch can be sold and turned into luno. <lf>Sometimes you can catch items other than fish. ......?
Tactical Abilities Alpha, which enhance tactical skills, can be taught by <lf>class masters. <lf>You will learn the abilities by meeting the release requirements for each ability in exchange for <lf>the "Warrior Talisman". <lf><lf>The Talisman can be obtained <lf>by advancing through the adventure board for each class. This board can be obtained by completing <lf>requests from class partners.
Join the team!
You can search for a team ID or view a team card from someone else's adventurer card and apply to join <lf>. <lf>You can apply to join up to 5 teams at the same time. <lf>(However, you can only belong to one team at a time.) <lf>If you receive an invitation from a team, you can join that team by accepting <lf>.
Team Activities
■Team Card Information <lf>You can view the team cards <lf><lf>■Member List <lf>You can check the members belonging to the team and their permissions. <lf>You can also change the authority from the gear mark. <lf>There are four types of <lf>privileges: leader, sub-leader, assistant, and member, and the leader can operate all team operations. <lf>*If the leader has not logged in for more than 30 days, any member can take over the leader authority from <lf>anyone from the gear mark.
■ Application to Join <lf>Approve people who apply to join the team and add them as members. <lf>Approval can be done by the leader, sub-leader, or assistant.

Imagine's Limits
You can use the same Imagine as a material at the Imagine Laboratory to <lf>push an Imagine to its limit. <lf>Once an item of equipment has been pushed to its limit, it will have its status increased and will be able to inherit the abilities of <lf>the item of equipment from which it was made. <lf><lf>Some Battle Imagines will have their skills enhanced if they are pushed to +5, making them more useful in battle. <lf> <lf><lf>Mounted Imagine can be pushed to the limit up to +3. <lf>Once a Mounted Imagine has been pushed to its limit, it will be easier to get "Lucky Chance" at <lf>Mounted Caravan.
You can use the same Imagine as a material at the Imagine Laboratory to <lf>push an Imagine to its limit. <lf>Once an item of equipment has been pushed to its limit, it will have its status increased and will be able to inherit the abilities of <lf>the item of equipment from which it was made. <lf><lf>Some Battle Imagines will have their skills enhanced if they are pushed to +5, making them more useful in battle. <lf>
Mount Imagine's Limits
You can "break the limit" of <lf>Mount Imagine by using the same Mount Imagine as a material at the Imagine Laboratory. <lf><lf>The limit of Mount Imagine can be pushed up to +3. <lf>Once a Mounted Imagine has been pushed to its limit, it will be easier to obtain "Lucky Chance" at <lf>Mounted Caravan.
In the "Mounted Caravan" available from the Pioneer Station, <lf>you can dispatch M-Imagine in your possession and <lf>receive various items as a reward. <lf>By completing quests and exploring the field, <lf>you may discover new dispatch locations. <lf><lf>Registering an M-Imagine to a dispatch request will reward you <lf>according to the dispatch time. <lf>The more M-Imagines you dispatch, the more reward you will receive. <lf><lf>M-Imagines can still be equipped and mounted while they are being dispatched.
The "Attack Checker" is a facility that allows you to <lf>measure how much damage you can do. <lf><lf>If you have a party beforehand, you can measure the damage with <lf>party. <lf><lf>Interacting with the central portal will take you to the measurement site. <lf>If you are in a party, all members of the party will move to the measurement site. <lf><lf>After moving to the measurement site, the process ends after a certain period of time has elapsed or by interacting with the portal at <lf>.
You can choose which Medals of Honor to display on your Adventurer Card. <lf>Medals of Honor can be obtained <lf>by completing some achievements and clearing high difficulty content.
Here is a list of the medals obtained so far. <lf>Medals can be attached to cards by going to "Communicate" in the command menu &gt; "Adventurer Cards" <lf>. <lf>Up to three medals can be attached to a card, so <lf>play through the various contents to obtain your medals.
Party member information can be viewed. <lf>The leader can transfer leadership, kick, and call members. <lf>Kick: Remove a party member from the party. <lf>Transfer leadership: Transfers leadership to a party member. <lf>Dissolve party: Dissolve the current party. <lf>If you cannot find a party member in the same zone, <lf>"Join Members" can be used to gather <lf>party members in the same channel as you.
Also, if you turn on "Party Now", <lf>it will <lf>automatically party with players who have the "Party Now" feature turned on nearby. <lf>Both turning "Party Now" on and off can be done by pressing <lf><span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="NowParty"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; long. <lf><lf>If you move to a zone with "Party Now" turned on, <lf>will automatically turn "Party Now" off. <lf>If you want to recruit members again, please turn "Party Now" ON again at <lf>.
The recruiting list shows parties that are looking for members. <lf>When you select a party, you will join that party. <lf>Clicking on "Recruit" will allow you to <lf>recruit your own party members. <lf>You can set the criteria to recruit members of your choice.
The ranking board located in the city is <lf>where you can view the rankings of various contents. <lf><lf>Some contents have special rewards for the top ranking <lf>and the "View Rewards" button at the top of the ranking board <lf>allows you to check the details of the rewards. <lf>Ranking rewards will be sent after the ranking period is over. <lf>Train your skills and aim to be ranked.
Some equipment can be "disassembled" to remove items. <lf>Equipment that can be crafted can often be taken out of <lf>some of the items used during the crafting process. <lf>Some items can only be obtained by disassembling.
You can decorate your room on the second floor of the Coin Pavilion with ornaments and other furnishings. <lf>Place the furnishings of your choice and arrange your room to your liking. <lf>You can adjust the angles of the furnishings, so <lf>you can find the direction that looks best. <lf>Furnishings can be obtained at the souvenir exchange.
This screen lists limited-time events. <lf>Click the banner on the left side of the screen to display the event screen. <lf>You can check the details in "Rewards" and "How to play" at the bottom of the screen. <lf>(You can also receive rewards on the "Rewards" screen.) <lf>The remaining duration of the event and the remaining time until the end of receiving rewards are shown under the banner <lf>. <lf>Be careful not to miss out on any rewards.
Key Character Quests allow you to Accept requests from your friends in the <lf>main quest, such as Feste. <lf>Play them to learn more about your friends and get <lf>special rewards.
aid
When a character's HP reaches 0, the character is disabled from fighting. <lf><span color="Action">Press and hold [&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Interaction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; to return to a nearby resurrection point. <lf>You can be revived on the spot by having another player rescue you. <lf>If you lose combat, use chat or stamps to ask for help.
List of buffs and debuffs
1 Damage Dealt...Increases the damage dealt. <lf>2 Damage Dealt...Decreases the damage dealt. <lf>3 Damage Received...Decreases the damage received from the Enemy. <lf>4 Damage Received. ...Damage Accepted from an Enemy is increased. <lf>5 HP Absorption...A portion of the damage dealt is converted to your own HP.
1 Super Armor...No longer enters the "frightened" state. <lf>2 HP Continuous Recovery...HP is recovered in small amounts at regular intervals. <lf>3 Quick Charge...Accumulation Speed of Tame Attacks is increased. <lf>4 Slow Charge...Accumulation Speed of Tame Attacks is slowed. 5 Sincerity Rate Increased...Sincerity activation rate is increased. ...Slow Charge slows down the speed at which tame attacks are built up. <lf>5 Crit Rate Up ...Increases the activation rate of the Crit Rate Up.
1 Quick Interval...speeds up the <lf> count of skill intervals. <lf>2 Slow Interval...slows down the <lf> count of skill intervals. <lf>3 Movement Speed Up...increases movement speed. <lf>4 Movement Speed Down...Movement speed is slowed down. <lf>5 Disable Status Abnormal...You will not be affected by status abnormalities. 6 Disable Status Abnormal...You will not be affected by status abnormalities.
1 Quick interval...Shortens the interval of a skill. <lf>2 Slow interval...Lengthens the interval of a skill. <lf>3 Movement speed up...Makes movement speed faster. <lf>4 Movement speed down ...Movement speed is slowed down. <lf>5 Disable Status Abnormal...You will not be affected by status abnormalities.
1 Stamina Recovery Speed Up...Stamina recovery speed will increase. <lf>2 Stamina Recovery Speed Down...Stamina recovery speed will decrease. <lf>3 Stamina Consumption Down...Stamina consumption will decrease. <lf>4 Score Acquisition Rate Up ...Score acquisition rate in Score Attack will be <lf>increased. <lf>5 Recovery amount of HP will be increased...Recovery amount of HP will be increased.
1 Quick Aid...speeds up the speed of rescuing other players <lf>. <lf>2 One-Time Critical...makes your next hit a <lf>critical hit. <lf>3 Sentinel...reduces the ease of being targeted by the Enemy. <lf>4 Auto Heal...When your HP is below a certain percentage, <lf>or after a certain amount of time, your HP will be automatically Recovery. <lf>5 Scape Armor...You will no longer be "frightened" and <lf>Accept a certain amount of damage from the enemy. <lf> (If the amount exceeds the amount that can be nullified, you will Accept the amount of damage that exceeds the amount.)
1 Quick Aid...speeds up <lf>the speed at which you can rescue other players.
In addition, there are buffs and debuffs for each Element effect up or down <lf>Element effect value up or down. <lf>(Image shown is for Fire Element)
You can take on the <lf>dungeons solo or with your current party members. <lf>Some missions allow you to enter with an impromptu party <lf>and apply to be matched. <lf><lf>Once you have completed a dungeon, it will be added to the "Missions" section of the command menu at <lf>. star vein hole
The "star vein holes" are natural transfer portals, so to speak. <lf>They are scattered around the world, each leading to a different location. <lf>If you see one, you should check it out.
Plug attachment <lf>allows you to attach an item called an ability plug to your weapon <lf>to enhance it. Ability plugs have their own effects <lf>and are effective when attached to the sockets of the weapon. <lf>　(Weapons with no available sockets cannot be plugged.) <lf>In addition, you may need a special <lf>material item called "Union Paste" to attach plugs to your weapon.
■Plug Tuning <lf>Changes the accuracy of installed abilities. <lf><lf>■Plug Removal <lf>removes installed ability plugs. <lf>　Normally, removed ability plugs are broken and lost, but with <lf>a special ticket, you can have the ability plug removed for <lf>reuse. <lf><lf>■ Expand Sockets <lf>Expand the sockets on your weapons. <lf>　New ability plugs can be attached to the increased sockets.
■Tuning <lf>Changes the accuracy of installed abilities. <lf><lf>■Plug Removal <lf>removes installed ability plugs. <lf>　Normally, removed ability plugs are broken and lost, but with <lf>a special ticket, you can have the ability plug removed for <lf>reuse. <lf><lf>■ Expand Sockets <lf>Expand the sockets on your weapons. <lf>　New ability plugs can be attached to the increased sockets.
■Special Effect Tuning <lf>changes the effect and effect value of Special Effects on a weapon. <lf>　(The effect may be reduced as a result of the change.) <lf>Special Tickets can be used to <lf>only draw Special Effects of the current rarity or higher, or to <lf>increase the effect value by one level.

Some Enemies may change shape, such as a part of the body Accepting more than a certain amount of damage may <lf>be damaged. <lf>Enemies that are destroyed in parts may receive <lf>bonuses, such as being downed when their parts are destroyed.

In the livery store <lf>you can change the color of any outfit you own. <lf>You can change the color at any time. <lf>When you change the color of an outfit, <lf>a special coloring dye is consumed.
Staining - Lightness Saturation
The coloring store can also adjust lightness and saturation. <lf>You will need a toning agent to make the adjustments, but it will greatly expand your dye range. <lf>Go to the coloring store <lf>to create your own original color for your costume.
The "Wandering Gastronomist" assists adventurers. <lf>He wanders around the world and serves <lf>players tempting dishes made from local ingredients. <lf>Eating his food will give you a variety of buffs, so <lf>be sure to talk to him when you see him.

In the team reception area, you can create your own new team or submit a request to join an existing team at <lf>. <lf>Joining a team is a great way to interact with your friends and <lf>adventure, so join a team first.

Enemy Leader
Enemies have a leader who gives instructions to the <lf>party, marked with a star. <lf><lf>Defeat the leader who gives instructions to other enemies to <lf>advance the battle.
Inside the dungeon, <lf>there are various tricks waiting to block the adventurer's way. <lf><lf>If you pass over the "Poison Puddle," you will be affected by a poisonous condition and your <lf>HP will gradually decrease. Watch your step in the dungeon.
When you touch the fog that "Spray Trap" spews, you may be exposed to dangerous conditions such as <lf>Paralysis. <lf><lf>Poisoning......Accepts damage at regular intervals <lf>Paralysis......Acts are canceled at regular intervals <lf>Fatigue......Loses Stamina for a regular period of time <lf>Skill unavailable...... cannot use skills for a certain period of time
evasive attack
After evading <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Dodge"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt;, <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="MainAction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; and <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="SubAction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; can be used <lf>simultaneously to perform an "evasion attack". <lf>Evade the Enemy's attack and turn to counterattack from the evasion attack!
violent attack
Melee classes such as Aegis Fighter and Twin Striker can perform "assault attacks" by using <lf><span color="Action"> [&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="MainAction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; and <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="SubAction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; simultaneously <lf>in the air. <lf>Strike at an enemy that is in a low position with a hard attack!
Just avoid
There is a certain period of time during which the player is invincible when evading. <lf>If you successfully evade during the invincibility period, an effect will occur and you will be able to <lf>"Just Evade". <lf>If you perform an evasion attack at this time, the performance of the evasion attack will be improved. <lf>Let's watch the enemy's behavior and try to perform a just evasion!
This close-range class is active on the front lines, making full use of offensive and defensive skills. <lf>It attracts enemies and delivers a powerful blow from a counter. <lf>The counter is powerful, but be careful of the "Shield Gauge. <lf>If you defend against an enemy's attack with your shield, your shield gauge will decrease. <lf>When the shield gauge runs out, the shield cannot be used for a certain period of time. <lf><lf>Weapons available...one-handed sword, shield <lf>Class Gauge...Shield Gauge <lf>Ultimate Skill...Glitter Mode

Normal attacks <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="MainAction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; are exclusive to each class. <lf>By raising the skill level of the normal attack, <lf>new attacks can be derived.
Class actions <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="SubAction"/><span color="Action">] &lt;/&gt; are skills specific to each class. <lf>The skills will be based on the features of the <lf>class, such as attack, defense, and recovery of the class gauge.
Ultimate Skill (ULT) <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="SpecialSkill"/><span color="Action">] &lt;/&gt; is an exclusive special move prepared for <lf>each class. <lf>They take a long time to become available again, but their effects are tremendous. <lf>Check the "Skill Board" for details on the skills of each class.
These skills are the mainstay of battle. <lf>Each class has a wide variety of skills, and up to eight can be set. <lf>You can specialize in a few systems or set them in a well-balanced way. <lf>Find the combination of skills that fits your battle style!
This ability enhances the performance of tactical skills. <lf>Tactical skills become even more powerful, but <lf>you cannot have more than one on at the same time, so <lf>set the tactical ability that best suits the situation.
Class Abilities are abilities that enhance a class' strengths or compensate for its weaknesses. <lf> They are learned by raising the class level, and are effective when set on the <lf>Battle Build screen. <lf><lf>There are also shared abilities that can be set by other classes, so it is a good idea to check the <lf>Battle Build screen to see if there are any shared abilities that you can set <lf>.
Base Abilities are abilities that increase <lf>basic stats such as ATK and DEF. <lf>Raising the class level also raises the level of the base ability, making <lf>it more effective.

Photo mode is a feature that allows you to take your time and enjoy taking pictures. <lf>There are two modes: camera operation mode and player operation mode. <lf><lf>If you take a screenshot while in photo mode, <lf>it will automatically be saved in the following folder. <lf>(The destination can be changed in the options) <lf>(Windows "My Documents" folder) <lf>\BlueProtocol\Screenshots <lf>You can also register the photos you have taken in "Albums" <lf>and view them in-game or use them on your Adventurer Card.
Weapons plug mounted
You can enhance <lf>weapons by attaching an "Ability Plug" to a weapon with an open socket. <lf><lf>The higher the accuracy of the plug, the higher the effective value of the ability. <lf>(You can check the accuracy by the number of stars.) <lf><lf>You can install plugs from "weapon modifiers" in town. <lf>Attach the ability plugs that match your class and fighting style <lf>to gain an advantage in battle.
Plug tuning allows <lf>to readjust the effect values of abilities plugged into a weapon. <lf><lf>Plug Tuning readjusts all abilities once. <lf>Abilities you do not want to adjust can be <lf>prevented from readjusting by using a keep ticket.
Tuning allows you to readjust the <lf>effect values of abilities plugged into a weapon. <lf>Tuning readjusts all abilities at once. <lf>Abilities you do not want to tune can be prevented from <lf>readjusting by using a keep ticket.
level sink
When you join a mission through matching, <lf>if your character's "class level" or parameters are higher than the specified values, <lf>"Level Sync" will be applied. <lf><lf>When Level Sync is applied, the damage dealt to the enemy will be <lf>adjusted to the appropriate class level for the mission. <lf><lf>When you participate in a mission alone or in a pre-mission party only <lf>, level sync will not be applied.
If a character's Class Level is higher than the <lf>specified value when participating in a mission, "Level Sync" will be applied. <lf>Level sync does not affect HP, but the damage <lf>inflicted on the enemy will be adjusted to <lf>the appropriate class level.
In-situ rotation of characters
Only with keyboard operation, <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="OrientToCamera" operateMode="MouseAndKeyboard"/><span color="Action">] &lt;/&gt; can be entered to rotate the <lf>player character on the fly. <lf><lf>This is a useful operation when shooting in photo mode.
Resurrection from inability to fight
If you are knocked down by an Enemy in the field or <lf>fall from a height and become incapacitated in combat, you can be revived at a revival point near <lf>. <lf>You can also be revived on the spot <lf>by being rescued by other players in the vicinity when you are incapacitated.
Special state change
1 Frailty <lf>While in Frailty, movement speed is reduced, Damage Dealt is reduced, Damage Received is increased, and the count of <lf>skill intervals is slowed. <lf>You also cannot use Mounted Imagines. <lf><lf>2 Possession <lf>When you use some Battle Imagines, you will become "possessed" and <lf>Accept special benefits such as increased status for a certain amount of time. <lf>What effects are triggered differ for each Battle Imagine.
1 Frailty <lf>While in Frailty, movement speed is reduced, Damage Dealt is reduced, <lf>Damage Received is increased, and the interval between skills is extended. <lf>It also prevents the use of Mount Imagine.
2 Possession State <lf>When you use some Battle Imagines, you become "Possessed" <lf>and Accept special benefits such as increased status for a certain amount of time. <lf>What effects are triggered differ for each Battle Imagine.
Wall that can be broken
There are places in the dungeon that appear to be dead ends but can be <lf>passed through by attacking them. <lf><lf>Some trees, rock walls, and iron grates can also be destroyed <lf>so if you find a suspicious place, attack it.
Number of resurrections
In missions with a limited number of resurrections, <lf>you will not be able to resurrect yourself after a certain number of resurrections are consumed. <lf>If you are forced to resurrect yourself in that state, you will fail the mission. <lf>Rescues from other players are not counted in the number of resurrections, so <lf>be proactive in rescuing other players.
Score Attack is a content in which you compete with <lf>other players to see how much you can score within a time limit. <lf><lf>Scores are added by damaging or destroying enemies. <lf>The score can be multiplied by using a combo of consecutive attacks and special suppliers <lf>, which makes it possible to score efficiently. <lf>A certain amount of score can also be obtained by destroying placed objects such as boxes. <lf><lf>Score attack rankings can be checked on the "Ranking Board" located at <lf>throughout the city.
Endless Tower is a content where you aim <lf>to reach the highest possible level without losing combat within a time limit. <lf>By clearing certain conditions on each floor, <lf>a portal to the next floor will be released. <lf>Once you clear a certain level, you will receive a reward for reaching the next level. <lf>While aiming for the achievement reward, do your best to clear the top floor.
There are places in the field where you can camp. <lf>You can heal your wounded body by a fire in the center of the camp. <lf>If you find some wood, light it. <lf>Sitting near the fire will help you recover HP more quickly.
There is a ranking board in town that can be accessed at <lf>to view the rankings of various contents at <lf>. <lf><lf>Some contents have special rewards for the top ranking people. <lf>The "View Rewards" button at the top of the ranking board can be used to <lf>view the details of the rewards.
<span color="Action">Entering [&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="ShortcutRing"/><span color="Action">] &lt;/&gt; will display a shortcut ring. <lf>You can register gestures, canned messages, and stamps to the shortcut ring <lf>for quick use. <lf>You can also register items, which is useful during battles. <lf><lf>To edit the shortcut ring, press <lf><span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="EditShortcutRing"/><span color="Action">] &lt;/&gt; while the ring is displayed to open the edit screen. <lf>Canned sentences and other items registered here can be used immediately at any time and are useful for communication during <lf>missions.
Element of weakness
Some weapons have Elements. <lf>When the Enemy's Weak Point Element matches the weapon's attribute, the <lf>damage notation will change, indicating an increase in Damage Dealt. <lf>You can defeat the enemy quickly by striking its weak point attribute, so <lf>be aware of the weapon's Element as well.
Now it's time to take to the field!
In the field, a variety of enemies await you. <lf>A yellow alert will appear when you are spotted by an Enemy, and a <lf>red alert will appear when you are identified as an attack target, so proceed with caution <lf>to avoid being caught by surprise.
You can also find out the <lf>name and level of an enemy by looking at its nameplate. Enemies that are higher level than you will be harder <lf>to damage even if you attack them, and if the level difference is more than a certain level, <lf>your attacks will not do any damage. <lf>If you see a purple nameplate, try to avoid it.

From the command menu, select the portal on the modern map at <lf>to return to the present day. <lf>To go back to the Pillar of Divinity 1000 years later, you can go to <lf>and use the transfer device by the entrance to the Pillar of Divinity in the present day. <lf>If you are not ready, return to the present day and get ready.

When your adventurer rank is raised.
Congratulations, you are now a member of the Adventurers' Association of America. Your adventurer rank is now 2. <lf>Myulie has given you a <lf>board to further increase your adventurer rank. <lf>This time, the board has an adventure board that rewards you <lf>with E-imagine materials for some of the challenge squares. <lf>You will be able to craft equipment just by advancing the board, so <lf>receive your rewards as soon as you complete the assignment for the shiny squares. <lf><lf>First, you should talk to Jake, <lf>your senior, again while advancing the adventure board you just received.
The Rush Battle, which can be challenged from Adventurer Rank 3, is <lf>a mission for adventurers who are skilled enough to become stronger. <lf>You can participate in these missions by selecting "Mission" from the Command Menu. <lf>Adventurers who win the Rush Battle will get items to <lf>make them stronger.
Move quickly through the field
This time, Mount Imagine is <lf>gifted as a reward for the Adventure Board. After equipping it from the command menu, you can mount it at <lf><span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="ImagineMount"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt;. <lf>There are some places where you cannot mount it, but when moving around the field, <lf>you can Quick Cooldown your travel time considerably, so use it proactively.
Have you already tried the new mission <lf>"Endless Tower" that appears when you advance in the main quest? <lf><lf>Endless Tower is a content in which you aim to <lf>reach the highest possible level without losing the ability to fight within a time limit. <lf>By clearing certain conditions on each floor, <lf>a portal to the next floor will be released. <lf>Once you clear a certain level, you will receive a reward for reaching the next level. <lf>While aiming for the achievement reward, do your best to clear the top floor.
The Evergreen Desert, which is often visited by mid-level adventurers and above, is <lf>a fairly vast area. <lf>There is a town called Salamzart in the northwest, but <lf>countless adventurers have lost their lives before reaching it. <lf>Be sure to be well prepared before you venture out.
Enhance your class!
The desert area is a region with many strong enemies. Be sure to raise your class level and strengthen your <lf>equipment. <lf>Also, by raising the class level of other classes, <lf>you can obtain "shared abilities" and strengthen yourself. <lf>When you are stuck, it is a good idea to look at other classes as well.
Carefully select your equipment!
You are now at a rank where you can safely call yourself an advanced adventurer. <lf>You probably have <lf>quite a few weapons, Enhance Imagines, and Battle Imagines. <lf>Each piece of equipment has different Elements, Abilities and Skills <lf>. <lf>Choose the right equipment for the right situation and take advantage of the battle.

This <lf>function allows you to share your designated location and enemy with your party members. <lf><lf><span color="Action">You can place a pin by pressing [&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="pushpin"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt;, or by pressing and holding <lf><span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Pushpin"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; to display the sights, and then releasing <lf>to place the pin on the spot. <lf>The placed pin will also appear on the minimap. <lf>The time to place a pin at one time is short. <lf>You can use it to share the direction you want to go or the enemy you are targeting.
Mission Type
There are several types of missions <lf>Additional and advanced exploration: The objective is to step through the dungeon. <lf>Free exploration: This content allows you to stay in the dungeon for an unlimited time. <lf>Rush Battle: Combat-specific content to test the skills of adventurers. <lf>Endless Tower: Longer than normal missions. <lf>The first reward is given by clearing a floor in the middle of the mission. <lf>Time Attack, Score Attack: Compete with other players for <lf>rankings. <lf>Raid missions: Multiplayer content for up to 30 players. <lf><lf>Details of each content can be found in the Travel Guide.
delivery quest
Season Pass Quests are quests that reward you <lf>for completing tasks within a set period of time. <lf>You can check what quests are available now <lf>by going to "Season Pass" &gt; "Season Pass Quests" in the command menu. <lf>You can also receive rewards for completed quests on this screen. <lf><lf>Daily Quests: Quests that are available every day. <lf>Weekly Quests: Quests are delivered once a week. <lf>Seasonal Quests: Quests that can be attempted during the season.
Delivered Quests are quests that reward <lf>for completing tasks within a set period of time. <lf>You can check what quests are available now at <lf>by going to "Quests" &gt; "Delivered Quests" in the command menu. <lf>You can also receive rewards for completed quests on this screen. <lf><lf>Daily Quests: Quests that are delivered every day. <lf>Weekly Quests: Quests are delivered once a week. <lf>Seasonal Quests: Quests that can be completed during the season. <lf>Bonus Quests: Quests that are delivered at various times, such as in conjunction with events. <lf>
Upgrading your "Season Pass" to a paid plan during the season will add <lf>daily, weekly, and season quests. <lf>Completing them will not only make it easier to accumulate reward season points and increase your <lf>season rank, but also add <lf>season rank rewards. <lf>Some rewards are only available with the paid Season Pass, so <lf>we encourage you to upgrade to the paid plan.
Limited time equipment and items
Some equipment and items have an expiration date. <lf>They will be gone after the specified period, so be sure to use them within the <lf>period. <lf>(For weapons only, after the expiration date, the weapon will switch to a weapon with lower parameters <lf>) <lf>You can check the expiration date on the item's detail screen, etc.
locker
There are "lockers" in the city <lf>where you can easily access the warehouse. <lf>You can use them to move items in and out and sell them without having to go to the asset management desk <lf>.
Enemy nameplate
The name plate shows the name and level of the Enemy. <lf>Enemies that are too higher level than the player will not be able to do any damage <lf>and even if they are defeated, they will not gain any experience or items. <lf>On the other hand, an enemy that is too lower level than the player can be <lf>defeated, but you will get only a small amount of experience. <lf>Look at the nameplate and fight an enemy of the appropriate strength. <lf><lf>Also, please make use of the <lf>information icons on the nameplates, such as "Enemies that do not attack you," <lf>"Bosses," "Named Enemies," and "Targets of Quests, etc.".
burst bonus
When Elemental Charge accumulation value is accumulated and a burst is generated, <lf>it becomes a burst bonus time for a certain period of time. <lf>During the bonus time, Damage Dealt will be increased, and there is also a bonus that <lf>increases the Damage Dealt by Battle Imagine more, <lf>allowing you to deal damage more efficiently with Battle Imagine. <lf><lf>In addition, during the Burst Bonus Time, the Burst Finish Gauge is increased <lf>by accumulating Elemental Charge accumulation. <lf>When the gauge accumulates above a certain level, the Burst Finish Level is increased and the effect of <lf>Burst Bonus Finish can be increased. <lf>Aim for high damage by increasing the Burst Finish Level!
Chains can be made by giving attacks in quick succession. <lf>If the number of chains is increased, a bonus of increased Damage Dealt will be generated. <lf>Furthermore, if the number of chains is increased to a specific number, "Continuous HP Recovery" and <lf>"Damage Received Reduction" and other favorable effects for the player will be generated.
The number of chains is shared between you and the allies in your party. <lf>Note that if you are too far away from the player who is the party leader, you will not be able to <lf>Accept the effect of the chain. <lf><lf>The chain time in which chains can be connected <lf>becomes shorter and shorter as the number of chains increases. <lf>Also, if a chain is broken while a certain number of chains are connected, <lf>the chain will not occur for a certain period of time. <lf>Once you start a chain, be <lf>conscious of connecting the chain as much as possible.
swim
You can swim in certain areas where the water level is deep. <lf><span color="Action">You can swim quickly <lf>by pressing [&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="dash"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; while pressing <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Move"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt;. <lf>While swimming, you can also jump.
the passive
Accept an attack and press <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Dodge"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; at the right time when you go down to take <lf>ukemi. <lf>When ukemi, you can press <span color="Action">【&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Move"/><span color="Action">】&lt;/&gt; to take ukemi in <lf>any direction. <lf>You can get up quickly, so be proactive.
Enemy step jump
While jumping, you can stomp on the Enemy by jumping again to perform a <lf>two-step jump. <lf>Close classes such as Aegis Fighter and Twin Striker jump <lf>straight up, while remote classes such as Spell Caster and Blast Archer <lf>jump backward. <lf><lf>Although it consumes more Stamina, <lf>close classes can perform altitude bonus assault attacks, and <lf>remote classes can distance themselves from the Enemy in one fell swoop.
Easiness of being targeted by the Enemy
When you damage an Enemy or heal an ally, your <lf>Targetability from the Enemy will increase. <lf>Enemies will attack the player with the highest targetability. <lf>There are some attacks that increase the vulnerability and others that do not. <lf>
ground target
Some attacks have a ground target that appears <lf>when you press and hold the button. <lf>While the ground target is displayed, the camera will be in a slightly overhead view, and the attack is launched by releasing the button at the <lf>position you wish to aim.
interact
Opening doors, talking to people, climbing ladders, and other actions are called <lf>"interact" and can be done <lf>by <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Interaction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt;. <lf>First, let's open the door of this room by interacting <span color="Action">[&lt;/&gt; <key color="Action" action="Interaction"/><span color="Action">]&lt;/&gt; and <lf>.

Shared Ability Slots
The shared ability slots in the <lf>battle build have been opened now that the class level has reached 30. <lf>You will be able to set shared abilities learned in other classes to <lf>shared ability slots. <lf>If you have not yet experienced other classes, <lf>this is a good opportunity to experience other classes.
There are sometimes pink nappies, <lf>happy nappies, standing in the field. <lf>Finding many of them may be a good thing. <lf>Look carefully when exploring the field.
Treasure chests placed in fields and dungeons, as well as those found when <lf>defeating enemies, can be opened with the <lf>interact. <lf>Inside are various items such as consumption items and equipment. <lf>The more luxurious the appearance of the treasure chest, the more luxurious its contents are likely to be. <lf>If you find a treasure chest during your adventures, you should actively try to open it.
Battle tips for beginners
■Use directional derivatives of normal attacks <lf>Derivative attacks are produced by inputting the move key, etc., in conjunction with normal attacks. <lf>Each class has its own unique derivative attack, so check <lf>the skill board for more information. <lf>The vanguard class also has an attack method called "assault attack. <lf>Use it according to the situation.
■Watch the Enemy's Movement <lf>Pre-moves may occur before a powerful attack, so <lf>observe the Enemy's movement carefully. <lf>Don't just avoid it, but also aim for just evasion and <lf>try to use your guard well. <lf><lf>■ Be aware of buffs and debuffs <lf>There are various types of buffs that strengthen you and your allies and debuffs that weaken enemies <lf>. <lf>Some are powerful enough to change the battle situation, so <lf>understand the effects of each and use them to your advantage.
■ Exploit the Enemy's Weaknesses <lf>to damage it efficiently by exploiting its weak point attributes, or <lf>to generate attribute status abnormalities, using its attributes will <lf>make the battle easier. <lf>First, be aware of the Elements of your weapons, Battle Imagines, and Tactical Skills <lf>. <lf><lf>Consider when to use Battle Imagine and ULT. <lf>The longer the interval, the more effective they are and the greater the <lf>impact they can have on the battle. <lf>Use them when you have the right moment to do so.
Intermediate Battle Tips
■ Be aware of the target of the enemy <lf>When attacking or recovering, it is easy to become a target of the enemy. <lf>The vanguard should be careful that the target does not go to the rear guard, and the <lf>rear guard should be careful not to become a target. <lf>If you don't want to become a target, <lf>carefully watch the color of the enemy alert and attack when it is yellow, or <lf>reduce the frequency of your attacks.
■Check the abilities of your equipment. <lf>Check the Special Effects and Elements of your weapons and the abilities of your Imagine. <lf>The same piece of equipment may have different Special Effects and Abilities <lf>. Multiple items with the same abilities will add to the <lf>effect. Try to find and set equipment with <lf>abilities that are more appropriate for your class. <lf><lf>Try to be creative with your battle builds <lf>and set up class abilities that can help with things you are not good at, or set up battle imageries that can inflict low damage <lf>but can add abnormalities. <lf>Be aware of not only the effects of each, but also the combination of each.
■ Raise various classes <lf>When your class level reaches 30, you can use the shared ability slots <lf>to set shared class abilities of other classes. <lf>Get shared class abilities of various classes to expand the scope of <lf>battles.
Advanced Battle Tips
■Connect Chains <lf>The more chains you have in your party, the shorter the time you can <lf>connect chains. <lf>However, when the number of chains exceeds a certain number, <lf>a buff is applied to strengthen the party, so <lf>be aware of the time remaining to connect chains.
■Try to devise a battle build. 2 <lf>When attacking a mission with a party, try <lf>to create a battle build that is designed with party play in mind. <lf>You can ask other players to compensate for your weak points by <lf>abandoning defense and specializing in attack, <lf>specializing in buffing and recovery, etc. It is a good idea to make a configuration that takes advantage of your strengths and <lf>compensates for your weaknesses with your party members.
Make use of the Burst Bonus <lf>During the Burst Bonus, not only do you accumulate Elemental Charge accumulation <lf>to increase your Burst Finish Level, but also <lf>a Damage Burst Bonus multiplier is added to your Elemental Charge attacks. <lf>Element attacks with Battle Imagine will increase <lf>the bonus multiplier even more, so <lf>be proactive and aim for it.

The "No Entry Trap" is a gimmick in which a fence comes out from the floor. <lf>You cannot pass through the trap while the fence is out, and you have to aim for the timing <lf>when the fence retracts into the floor to pass through. <lf>There are also some types of fences that stay out, so if <lf>you find a no-passage trap that does not move, bypass it and proceed.

Enemies have unique "strains". <lf>Knowing which enemy belongs to which lineage will make it easier to <lf>find "Special Effects" that work well for that enemy. <lf>The following is a list of the enemies and their typical enemies. <lf><lf>Boa Lineage: Rumble Boa, Uribo <lf>Goth Lineage: Horngoat <lf>Fox Lineage: Land Fox <lf>Hawk Lineage: Land Hawk <lf>Sphere Lineage: Floating Eye <lf>Goblin Lineage: Goblins

List of state changes
1 Stun...the user becomes inoperable for a few seconds. <lf>2 Sleep...the user falls asleep and becomes inoperable for a certain period of time. <lf>3 Poison...HP continuously decreases. <lf>4 Paralysis...the user's actions are canceled at certain intervals. 5 Darkness...the user's attacks miss at a certain rate. <lf> 5 Darkness...Attacks miss with a certain probability.
1 Skill Usage Disabled...You will not be able to use your skills. <lf>2 Fatigue...You will have zero Stamina for a certain period of time. <lf>3 Item Usage Disabled...You will not be able to use items for a certain period of time. <lf>4 Nappo Transformation...You will turn into a Nappo. You will be transformed into a nappo. <lf>5 Bind...You will not be able to move from the spot.
1 HP Leak Condition...when attacked, the attacker recovers. <lf>2 Fear...becomes inoperable and attempts to move away from the target. <lf>3 Laceration...HP is continuously reduced. 4 Fear...the attacker's HP is reduced. 5 Fear...the attacker's HP is reduced. 6 Fear...the attacker's HP is reduced.
1 HP Leak State...when attacked, the attacker recovers. <lf>2 Fear...becomes inoperable and attempts to move away from the target.

Blitz Lancer Features
Blitz Lancer can be activated with the imprint to Accept various benefits <lf>. There are three types of imprints. <lf>Imprint - Burst: Increases the damage of attacks that hit when activated. <lf>Imprint - Emptiness: Reduces Damage Dealt to the activated enemy. <lf>Imprint - Tangle: Reduces Movement Speed to the activated enemy. <lf>Activating all three types simultaneously will cause a ranged attack in addition to the above effects. <lf><lf>Class abilities and tactical skills can also be used to enhance the effects of the imprint <lf>. Since the number of possible sets is limited, <lf>consider what order to activate the skills in order to <lf>find the best combo route.

This <lf>class uses a two-handed spear and specializes in hit-and-away. It inflicts an "imprint" on the enemy and applies a skill that activates the <lf>imprint at any given time to cause a condition. <lf>Use the class action Escape Leap to keep a good distance and fight <lf>. <lf><lf>Available Weapons...Two Handed Spear <lf>Class Gauge...Imprint <lf>Ultimate Skill...End Of Javelin
There are three types of imprints, and activating all three at the same time will also cause <lf>additional ranged attacks. <lf>Mark of Burst...Increases the damage of attacks that hit when activated <lf>Mark of Emptiness...Reduces Damage Dealt to the activated enemy <lf>Mark of Entanglement...Reduces movement speed to the activated enemy
■ Buffs and debuffs exclusive to Blitz Lancer <lf>1 Mark Trigger...Increases the effect when the imprint is digested. <lf>2 Hunting Zone...Generates a shockwave <lf>at the hit point of the leap shot, attracting the enemy that was hit. <lf>Escape Leap interval is lost during the duration of the effect. <lf>3 Prepare Mode...Increases the power of <lf>equipped T-skill only once, depending on the number of imprints digested within a certain time after activation. <lf>There is an upper limit to the power increase.

Join the defense!
Defensive battle is a content in which multiple players join forces to defend a base against <lf>numerous oncoming enemies. <lf>To prevent the destruction of the "Engram Wall" that surrounds the defense target, <lf>cooperate with your gathered friends and fend off the onslaught of enemies. <lf>In this mission, a contribution ranking will be displayed when you clear the mission, and you will be rewarded with bonuses for finishing at <lf>the top, destroying more devices, and so on.
Defensive battle is a content in which multiple players join forces <lf>to defend defensive targets from numerous enemies. <lf>Defend the "Engram Wall" that surrounds the defense target. <lf>You will win the game if you can defend it within the time limit, and you will lose if it is destroyed. <lf>You can also <lf>win by defeating the boss and forcing the enemy to retreat.
Gimmicks such as Enemy Gates will appear in the defense battle. <lf>When a gimmick appears, it will be displayed on the map. <lf>Let's destroy it aggressively to gain an advantage in the battle. <lf>Also, some enemies move differently than usual, such as targeting only engram walls <lf>, so observing them carefully and dealing with them <lf>is a shortcut to the strategy. <lf><lf>If you defeat all the enemies by the time limit, including the boss enemy, <lf>you will win the game completely. <lf>It is very difficult, but you will get a bonus reward if you complete the game <lf>, so if you can afford it, let's aim for it.
It is an object that reinforces the entire Enemy. <lf>It can be destroyed by attacking it. <lf><lf>If left behind, the Enemy will continue to be strengthened, so <lf>be proactive in destroying it.
The "Simple Transfer Portal" is a device that players use to move around. <lf>By touching the portal, <lf>you are instantly transported to another simple transfer portal. <lf>It may lead to a place you could not go or to an unknown place. <lf>The destination may be dangerous, so proceed with caution.
Weapons, B-Imagine, and E-Imagine can be "Limit Breaking" using the same type of equipment and <lf>materials dedicated to Limit Breaking. <lf><lf>The equipment that has been "Limit Breakthroughed" will have its status increased and will be able to inherit the Special Effects and Abilities <lf>of the equipment that was used as the material. <lf><lf>The higher the limit breakthrough value, the lower the Success Rate, <lf>but the more the Success Rate increases, the more the status of the equipment increases. <lf>You can train your equipment to be your ideal equipment.

Duplication of buff effects
If the same effect is duplicated by <lf>different means, such as increasing the drop rate of a Network Café benefit, <lf>item, or skill, the <lf>effect values will all be added together. <lf><lf>(If the effect is duplicated among consumable items, such as using Drop Drop G2 during the effect time of Drop Drop G1, the effect value will be added to the total value of the consumable items.
Drop at party
A treasure chest will only drop once in a party and will refer to the value of the member with the highest drop probability in the <lf>party. <lf>The contents of the treasure chest are determined on an individual player basis. <lf>In the case of drop items such as Uribo's tail, <lf>is determined on a player-by-player basis, and the drop probability is also referenced to <lf>each player's respective numbers.

Exceed System
Class experience gained after reaching the maximum class level will be stocked in the <lf>Exceed System. <lf>When the stocked experience is accumulated enough to raise one level, it will be converted into <lf>"Exceed Flam". <lf>The tokens can be exchanged for a variety of rewards at the souvenir exchange. <lf><lf>When the upper limit of the class level is released, <lf>the experience stocked until then will be discarded. <lf>When the class level limit is reached again, experience will be stocked from <lf>zero.
Exceed System Release
The maximum class level has been reached. <lf>From now on, experience gained in this class will be stocked in the <lf>Exceed System. <lf>For every 1 level up of experience stocked, you will receive one <lf>"Exceed Flam" which can be exchanged for various items at the <lf>Souvenir Exchange.

Parties and Channels
The field has "zones" and "channels". <lf>A zone is an area on the map, separated by a dotted line, that you can move through without <lf>loading. <lf>A zone is divided into multiple channels. <lf>(There are also multiple "channels" in a city.) <lf><lf>Even if players are in the same "Plain of the Rumbling Sea", they cannot see each other if they are in <lf>different channels. <lf>If you and your party members are in different channels, <lf>ask the leader to "join the party" and get together on the same channel <lf>.

Koaniani Forest has tree roots that expand and contract. <lf>Even paths that are blocked by roots during the day can be passed through at <lf>night as the roots shorten. <lf><lf>Because the Koaniani Forest is dangerous at night, it is best to use the open paths to explore while avoiding fighting <lf>enemies. <lf><lf>Also, if you get caught between the roots, you can escape by interlacting.
Enemy Rush" is an event that occurs during a mission. <lf>When even a single party member enters the event start area, <lf>rush will start, and the enemies will appear infinitely for a certain period of time. <lf><lf>Enemies appearing in the event tend to drop treasure chests, so <lf>try to defeat as many of them as possible within the time limit!
Enemies in the "lucky state" will always drop <lf>materials and treasure chests. <lf>(It may drop two or more treasure chests.) <lf><lf>There is no difference in strength between "Lucky Enemies" and normal enemies. <lf>When you find a "Lucky Enemy," be proactive in defeating it!
Weapon Special Effects
Weapons have "Special Effects" of different rarities. <lf>Special Effects come in three rarities: Legendary, Rare, and Normal. <lf>The higher the rarity, the more unique the effect. <lf><lf>Also, even if you have broken through the limit to the maximum, you can replace the Special Effect every time you <lf>break through the limit. <lf><lf>Collect many weapons and carefully select better effects to achieve <lf>higher difficulty content achievement.
Weapon Limit Special Effects
Weapons have a "Limited Special Effect" that is released when the weapon is pushed to its maximum limit, which gives <lf>a status UP type effect. <lf><lf>Even if a weapon has been pushed to its maximum limit, the Special Effect can be replaced each time the weapon is <lf>pushed to its maximum limit. <lf><lf>Collect as many weapons as you can, break through the limit, <lf>and aim to achieve high difficulty content.
